In the previous year’s growing season, N. Mahmud worked diligently in his fertilizer and pesticide-selling venture. He made enough income to improve his home and save for his children’s education expenses. As he was diligently selling fertilizer, his land has not been prepared. Mahmud has immediately taken the initiative to resume working on his land while selling fertilizer. He needs funds to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. Mahmud is optimistic his venture will be successful and all his efforts will improve his family’s welfare.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Maame Esi

texts.en:
Maame Esi E. is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer and she helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She has received senior high education.

Maame Esi sells smoked fish at Takoradi. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke for sale. She plans to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Badenya Ton 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  membres du groupe Badenya Ton 5 sont mariés majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants par femme. Elles habitent le village de Farabougou dans la commune rurale de Tesserela dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  prêt de campagne. 
Les membres du groupe vont cultiver de l’arachide et du mil.
Madame Mariétou   Traoré veut utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 25kg de semence d’arachide, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de sarclage dans ses champs. 
Elle se ravitaille en semence à la foire de Ségou et en main d’œuvre avec les hommes et les femmes du village. 
Elle compte récolter sur une superficie de 3,2 hectares: 10 sacs d’arachide, 5 sacs de mil et 2 sacs de sésame. Une partie de la production du mil et d’arachide est utilisée dans la consommation familiale tandis que tout le reste de la production est vendue à la foire de Ségou et Gouassola à une clientèle mixte. 
Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour prendre en charge de la scolarité des enfants et les besoins du foyer. 
Madame Mariétou  Traoré tout comme les autres membres du groupe a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans le village.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group Badenya Ton 5 are married women, mostly from large traditional families. They average 35 years of age and four children each. They live in the village of Farabougou, in the rural community of Tesserela, in Ségou (Mali’s fourth administrative region). They got acquainted through bonds of marriage and kinship. In order to increase their arable land, they turned to the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance organization for their first farming loan cycle. They plan to grow peanuts and millet. Mrs. Mariétou Traoré will use her loan to buy 25 kg of peanut seed and 2 bags of cereal fertilizer, and to recruit manpower for plowing and weeding. She gets her supplies of seeds at the Ségou fair and recruits men and women in her village. With 3.2 hectares of land, she expects to produce 10 sacks of peanuts, 5 sacks of millet and 2 sacks of sesame. Part of the millet and peanut harvests will be consumed at home, while the rest will be sold at the Ségou and Gouassola fairs to a mixed clientele. The profits will be used to pay for the children’s tuition and household expenses. Like the other group members, Mrs. Mariétou Traoré’s goal is to achieve food self-sufficiency in the village.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay for labor

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
M. Gulbahor is 39 years old. She is married with three children. To help her husband support the family, Gulbahor is running her own business. She sells jewelry and has been in this business for more than 5 years. Today, Gulbahor is requesting $2,700 US Dollars. She is planning to purchase new items of jewelry like earrings, rings, bracelets and chains to expand her product range. This is her fourth loan and she promises to observe all the procedures concerning the payment of the loan as she did with her previous loans.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase new products for resale

loans.name: Bisensiha

texts.en: Bisensiha J. sells cooking oil, tomatoes, sweet potatoes and onions. She is requesting a loan to stock both fresh and dried fish to sell. Bisensiha is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a store and stock food items to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of fresh and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline K. is currently in the business of selling bags of groundnuts and simsim (sesame seeds) at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize and millet to sell.  

Jackline is 37 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock bags of maize and millet to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver and Efua uses her income to support her husband in providing the needs of the children such as feeding and clothing. She has no educational background.

Efua buys fresh fish and smokes it for sale at Takoradi. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Dorsida

texts.en:
Dorsida K. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut paste at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock dried fish and tomatoes to sell.  

Dorsida is 38 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock dried fish and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella J. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil, tomatoes, dried fish and bread at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock onions and Irish potatoes to sell.  

Stella is 31 years old and married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock onions and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua N. is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver and Akosua uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She has received junior high education.

Akosua sells soft drinks and also prepares tea with fried eggs for sale at Takoradi. She sells the tea to those who would like to take their breakfast outside the home. Akosua will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks and ingredients to prepare breakfast for her customers.

With the new revenue from her extended business, Akosua plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks and ingredients to prepare breakfast for her customers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose P. is currently in the business of selling maize, millet and sorghum at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize and rice to sell.  

Rose is 42 years old and widowed. She has five children, two of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize and rice to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella T. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables, fish and fruits such as guava and oranges. She is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell.  

Stella is 47 years old and married to a builder. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes D. sells food items such as palm oil, smoked fish, eggs, and other items at Takoradi. She has received senior high education. She is divorced and has a child. She is able to manage her family with the income she makes from her sales.

Agnes’s loan will be used to buy additional food items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to enter into another kind of trade.

loans.use: To buy additional food items to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a single man with no children. He pays school fees for his younger brother after his parents got old and could not raise any money for the younger siblings to attend school. He has been driving a public vehicle for the last year; in addition, he operates a grocery for his other source of income. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan, he wants to pay for a public service vehicle license and purchase new tires. 

His customers are mainly market dwellers and passersby. George faces the major challenge of high competition and seasonality in his business. He hopes to own his own car-hire company. 

He decided to work with Yehu so as to get capital to finance his business. He rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To pay for a public service vehicle license and purchase new tires

loans.name: Omwavu Teyebaka Group-Kampala

texts.en: 45 year old O. Ayoo Polline says she has made strenuous and concentrated efforts to make her decade long restaurant business in Kampala a success, notwithstanding the competition and operational cost challenges that she has had to grapple with. To avoid courting failure in business, she has made the best of these hard bargains. Her business start up story began with a food vending business. It’s with savings from this that she began her current business. In a month, she makes 200,000 shillings as profits and with this loan she wants to buy more food supplies for her restaurant. This is her sole business and hence puts a lot of effort for it's continued success.

loans.use: The purchase of more food supplies for her  restaurant

loans.name: Gordwin

texts.en:
Gordwin is a married man and has no children. He has been operating a motorcycle business (a boda boda) for the last six years, passersby being his potential customers. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. In addition he runs a cosmetic shop to also contribut to his of livelihood. 

Gordwin faces the major challenge of transport costs being high in terms of purchasing petrol. His major goal is to be self reliant in future. He decided to work with Yehu to get financial support to boost his business. He rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Lweza Integrated Group-Kampala

texts.en:
Sometimes you have to go out of your way to ensure you make profitable use of your time when running a business. Lots of sacrifices have to be made as any successful business person will testify. For the last 6 years, 34 year old married mother of 4, N. Sarah has done her utmost with many odds stacked against her, to secure her place in the competitive retail business genre in Lweza-Kampala.  Sarah used to be a farmer; she still is though she has now gotten more inclined towards retailing. She credits her husband with giving her the pep talk to begin this business. 

On a monthly basis, she makes 300,000 shillings. She envisages her profits increasing by making additional purchases of goods in high favor with most of her old and new customers. With this loan, Sarah says she wants to buy more bags of sugar, plastics, rice and soft drinks for her shop. She says she will make more profits for her business with this high volume of goods.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of sugar, plastics, rice and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De La Asunción ["our Lady Of The Assumption"] Group

texts.es:
El comité Nuestra Señora de La Asunción nace hace más de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Una de las integrantes, es la señora Crisolina quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de San Lorenzo.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que todos los dias viaja hasta el mercado para atender su puesto de venta y de esa manera obtiene el ingreso para su familia.
Crisolina trabaja activamente dentro del comité y comenta que para ella es muy importante ya que le facilita la compra de las frutas y verduras que ella vende.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de frutas y verduras como manzana, naranjas, frutillas, cebollas, tomate, papa, locote.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuestra Señora de La Asunción" ["Our Lady of the Assumption"] was formed more than two years ago, through the leadership and support of another communal bank which was working in the same area. One of its members is Crisolina, who works selling fruits and vegetables at the San Lorenzo market. She is a very hard-working woman who goes to the market every day to work at her sales stand and thus obtain an income for her family. Crisolina works actively within the committee, and she comments that it is very important to her, since it facilitates the purchase of the fruits and vegetables she sells. She is requesting the loan to buy fruits and vegetables such as apples, oranges, strawberries, onions, tomatoes, potatoes and peppers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables such as apples, oranges, strawberries, onions, tomatoes, potatoes, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es:
Catherine vive en la zona de Alto irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es soltera y no tiene hijos.
La cliente, egresada de la carrera de arquitectura,  se dedica a la supervisión de obras y dirección de obras, por lo que el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cerámica para terminar una obra fina y así entregar la construcción terminada a sus dueños y recibir el pago por sus servicios. De esta manera, ella está creando una nueva forma de percibir ingresos en forma más rápida y eficiente.
Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito y la primera que requiere el apoyo de kiva.
texts.en:
Catherine lives in the Alto Irpavi neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She is single and has no children. Catherine has a degree in architecture, and supervises and directs construction projects. She will invest the loan requested in the purchase of tile to complete the finish work on a job so that she can deliver the completed construction to the owners and receive payment for her services. In this way, she can earn income in a more rapid and efficient manner. This is the first time that she has requested a loan, and the first time she has sought support from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tiles to complete the finishing touches on a construction project that she is supervising

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with two children who attend school. He has been operating his motorcycle repair business for the last two years tomotorcycle operators and sells parts in his shop .With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase spare parts for repair and pay for his business license. He has no other source of income. 

Suleiman faces the major challenge of high costs of spare parts. His major goals is to be self reliant and own a big garage in future. He decided to work with Yehu to get a loan to improve his business. He lives at a rental house with electricity but no piped water. He says food is his greatest monthly expense.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle repairs and pay for his business license.

loans.name: Mumuli Womens And Mens Development Group

texts.en: She went from selling one bottle of locally brewed crude alcohol to owning a restaurant and later a pub and depot. 40 year old N. Dorothy’s story reads more like a rag to riches tale. Over the course of the last decade, she has brought her hard work attitude to the fore front in a bid to establish a stable niche for herself in her pub and depot business in Kavule-Kampala. With time, she has won laurels and her business has expanded. She likes to describe herself as a down to earth person who relates well with people. Her 6 children have nothing but praise for their mom whom they say is kind hearted and loving. She may be divorced but single handedly, she has provided for them well. In a week’s period she makes 50,000 shillings. Dorothy also gets other profits from a rental business. With this loan, she wants to purchase more crates of beer, spirits and soda that she will resell to increase her profits.

loans.use: The purchase of more crates of beer and other drinks for her pub and depot

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Once you stop short of any measures aimed at uplifting your livelihood whether through doing business or through hard work in your trivial job, hard circumstances will be the order of your recurrent days. These are odds 25 year old L. Bashir did not want to face, having experienced firsthand how many people around his locality were suffering as a result of taking counter-productive decisions in their lives. 

Bashir is a courteous and warm hearted gentle young man who is a father of 1 child. 3 years ago he embarked on his retail shop business in Kimenyedde-Kayunga. In a week, he makes profits totaling to 190,000 shillings and in the near future, he is thinking about opening up a super market or going wholesale. With this loan, he wants to buy more retail stock for his shop. He is anticipating buying items such as rice, sugar, soap, beans and flour. With increased profits, he says he will be able to save more so that he make his dream of either opening a super market or going wholesale come true.

loans.use: The purchase of items such as rice, sugar,soap and maize flour to resell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with seven children whom all attend school. She has been operating her food stall business for the last three years. She also sells from home to her neighbors and school going children. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of maize flour, a sack of rice and beans. She has no other source of income.

She faces the challenges of high prices of food stuff and high competition. She hopes to be self reliant in the future and become a restaurant operator. She decided to work with Yehu to get financial assistance to boost her business. She lives at her own house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of maize flour, a sack of rice and beans.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La  Sra. Francisca se dedica a la venta de comestibles en su domicilio, tiene un hijo mayor que le ayuda en el negocio , ella es soltera.
  Se inicio en este rubro hace mas de 30 años en un negocio del mismo rubro, con un poco de capital abrió  su propio local.
 
 Ella  necesita de este crédito para la ampliación de su local , para dar mas comodidad a sus clientes.  
En el futuro  desea abrir otro local y dar  mas trabajo a su comunidad.
texts.en:
Francisca sells food from her home. She has an adult son who helps her with the business. She is single. She started in this line of work more than 30 years ago in a similar business. Once she acquired a little capital she opened her own place. She needs this loan to expand her business location to make it more comfortable for her customers. In the future, she hopes to open another location and give more work to her community.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lorenda

texts.en:
Lorenda is a resident of District 3, Sibalom, Antique. She is 57-years-old and widowed. She is seen as strong and determined to improve her status of living. She is a caring mother of four. All of whom are still going to school and need her support.

Currently, Lorenda is busy with the buying and selling of bamboo craft and charcoal to earn the means of daily living. When she received a small amount of capital from ASHI, she managed to put it all into her business. For her, business is an important factor, and she does not want to be a problem for her group mates with the weekly loan obligations.

She applied for a new loan amounting PHP 20,000.00 to have additional working capital for her business. Specifically, the loan fund will be use to purchase inventory of bamboo crafts and charcoal to sell.

Lorenda is a very good member of ASHI. She performs well in her business. When she has enough capital, she increases her business in order to gain more income. She hopes that through her loans availed in the ASHI partnership with KIVA; someday she will be able to save money as she is getting older. Along with the business success she is dreaming about, is the hope to see the graduation of her children at college and to see them find stable jobs.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of bamboo crafts and charcoal.

loans.name: Adonai Group

texts.es:
El comité Adonai nace mediante el deseo de las señoras de formar un grupo solidario con el objetivo de trabajar todas juntas para ayudarse entre ellas y al mismo tiempo a sus familias, buscando siempre en bienestar de la misma.
Una de las integrantes del comité es la señora Hilda quien se dedica  a la venta de comidas.
Ella hace los comestibles y los frece en su casa y los fines de semana sale con sus preparados hacia lugares concurridos para ofrecer su productos.
Es una mujer muy trabajadora ya con su trabajo ayuda para mantener de la mejor manera a su familia, y quiere seguir trabajando con sus compañeras ya que el crédito les facilita el trabajo.
En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingrediente de los comestibles que ella prepara especialmente para la carne ya que el precio del mismo es elevado.
texts.en:
The Adonai group was born through the desire of the women to form a solidarity group with the goal of working together to help themselves and their families, as they are always seeking to provide for the welfare of their families. One of the members of the group is Hilda, who sells food. She makes food and offers it from her house, and during the weekends she goes out with her dishes to busy areas to offer her products. She is a very hardworking woman whose work helps to support her family in the best way. She wants to continue to work with her fellow group members, since the loans facilitate her work. On this occasion she requests a loan to buy ingredients for the food she prepares, especially to buy meat, since the price of meat is high.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, condiments, cooking oil and meat

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 34 years old and married with four children.  Her children are 3, 6, 8, and 10 years old and her three eldest are in school.  She and her husband have been able to afford health insurance for the entire family.  They also keep a reserve of money for illnesses not covered by the insurance.  

Speciose buys handicrafts and sells them in the market. Her husband assists her with this job.  They have been doing this business for 7 years and have become known for selling high quality goods. With the loan she plans to increase the amount of handicrafts they sell.  She eventually hopes to be able to hire staff to assist her in the business. Her goal is to save enough to construct a house to live and work in. Also she hopes to save money to give to her children.

loans.use: Buying more handicrafts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
J. Batiste is a 36 year old man who is married with a three year old child.  He and his wife also take care of several orphans.  They have been able to purchase health insurance for the immediate family and orphans.  

J. Batiste is a farmer and owns a small shop.  His wife is also a farmer and they have been farming together for over six years.  With a loan, he plans to buy more food items and household goods to sell.  In addition, he will start buying crops from other farmers to sell in his store.  With the profits he hopes to buy domestic animals to raise.  He eventually wants to become self-sufficient and not have to depend on financing.  Before that point, he plans to pay off his loans and qualify for larger loans.

loans.use: Buying more food items and household goods to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Darlyn Joy

texts.en:
Darlyn Joy would like to request a larger loan for the sustainability and growth of her venture: a sari-sari (variety) store.

Sari-sari stores basically sell small quantities of various foodstuffs, grocery items and beverages. “Sari” is a native word for variety. This is a small store that is either attached to the owner’s house or in a small native cottage not far away from the owner’s house. Such stores are convenient for people in the village who live far from the market town.

Darlyn is determined to improve her business as well as the life of her family. Knowing that she can access financial support through loans has given her courage and faith that someday she will move away from the cycle of being poor.

Darlyn’s business has been very helpful in achieving her dreams. Her greatest hope is that her family will be complete if they have a baby someday. Her longterm goals are to have a full-fledged mini-grocery store and a happy family as well.

loans.use: To support the growth of her sari-sari store

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia is 44 years old and is married with six children who range from 4 to 23 years old. Her husband is a driver. They are proud to have purchased health insurance for the entire family.

Felecia is a farmer and also owns a small store. She sells the produce she grows and also buys and sells produce from local farmers. In addition, she sells general household goods in her store.

With the loan, Felecia plans to expand her garden and grow more crops and more types of crop. Her goal is to grow her business to a profit of 1 million Rwandan francs (approximately US$1,700) per year.

loans.use: To expand her garden and to buy more food crops to sell in her store

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, de 37 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propio trecho a base de adobe. Desde muy joven, Antonio descubrió que quería dirigir las cosas, es mas quería ser jefe de su propio negocio en un futuro próximo, desde luego que lo cumplió a base de mucho sacrificio, es así que produce y comercializa café. Él agradece a sus padres por las buenas lecciones de vida que lo brindaron, es por ello que trata de mejorar cada año en la actividad agrícola que realiza. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su querida esposa, pero en tiempo de sembrío y cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones con la finalidad de que le puedan facilitar la extracción de su producto final, en el que luego son llevados a vender en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. Su plan a futuro es seguir apostando en la actividad agrícola, para ello comprará nuevos terrenos, con el propósito de que pueda aumentar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con su cronograma de pagos, además está conforme con su grupo comunal, ya que le permitió mejorar su negocio agrícola. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono para que pueda dar mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
37-year-old Antonio is married and has two children who attend school. They all live together in the community of Villa Quintiarina, located at the edge of the Peruvian jungle, in their own adobe house.
At an early age, Antonio discovered that he liked to manage things. Moreover, he wanted to manage his own business early on. Of course, owning a successful coffee business came through much sacrifice. He is grateful to his parents for teaching him good life lessons that have encouraged him to keep improving his agricultural business year after year. He mostly works on his own, but sometimes his wife helps out. At harvest time he hires labourers to pick the crops, which are later sold at local collection centres.
His plan for the future is to keep investing in his farming business, buying new land to increase his production. This is his fifth MFP loan, which he is committed to repaying on time. He’s very satisfied with his communal group since it allows him to improve his business. He plans to use this requested loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertiliser to look after his coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies and fertiliser

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La Sra. Lilian A. tiene 28 años. Esta casada con el Sr. Fidenciano Chamorro tienen un hijo menor de edad. 
Tienen su casa propia en la ciudad de Capiata.
La Sra. Lilian tiene un local de Mini Cargas para celulares en donde también venden termos y guampas forradas trabajadas  en la ciudad de San Lorenzo hace 5 años. El Sr. le ayuda en la venta.
 La Sra. Lilian necesita de este crédito para adquirir mercaderìas en cantidad a menor precio.
 En el futuro desean habrir una sucursal en la ciudad de Luque donde también hay mucho movimiento.
texts.en:
Lilian A. is 28 years old. She is married to Fidenciano Chamorro, and they have a minor child. They have their own house in the city of Capiata. Lilian has a site where she sells electronic loads for mobile phones. She also sells thermos bottles and sheathed tea cups. She has worked in the city of San Lorenzo for five years. Her husband helps with the sales. Lilian needs this loan to get merchandise in large quantities for a lower price. In the future she wishes to open a branch in the city of Luque, where there is also a lot of activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thermos bottles, tea cups, and fabric, etc.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 40 years old and is married with eight children. Her children range from age 2 to 16, and seven of them are in school. Her husband is a farmer and together they can afford health insurance for the whole family.

Vestine has been a farmer for twenty-five years. She has a popular business due to the amount of time she has committed to it. She plans to use the loan to expand the number of crops that she grows. She also wants to sell her crops in more markets.

loans.use: To expand the number of crops that she grows

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 57 years old and has two children who are 20 and 25 years old. Both of the children have only completed primary school. She has also adopted four other children and has managed to pay for all of their health insurance.

Epiphanie sells fruit and vegetables and she has done this business for eighteen years. She needs a loan in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is 33 years old and is married to a driver who works for a tour company called Volcano. She has three children aged between 8 and 14 years.

Elina sells carrots, onions, and cabbages and has been doing this for twelve years. She intends to use the loan to invest in her business and increase her scale of operations.

If all goes well with her business, Elina has a vision of buying a small secondhand car to facilitate the transportation of her products from farmers to her selling point.

loans.use: To buy more carrots, onions and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Hassin

texts.en:
Hassin is a married woman and has four children who are between 5 and 15 years old. One of her children is in the secondary school while the rest are still in primary school. Her husband is an agricultural officer in the district.

Hassin trades in peas, wheat, beans and soybeans. She plans to use the loan to increase her inventory of grains and vegetables so that she can meet the demands of her clients. With the help of her husband and this loan, she intends to at least buy and sell one ton of food products per month.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of grains and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying ladies' and men's undergarments  (boxers, bras, panties, briefs, socks, stockings) and boys' and girls' outfits

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 34 years old and married with one child who is 13 years old and in school. Francoise and her family live with her mother and all are able to buy health insurance.

Francoise buys cassava locally and sells it in two different marketplaces. With the loan she hopes to expand her sales to more marketplaces, including Kigali, the capital city.

Francoise’s goal is to pay off her loans and qualify for larger loans. This way she can afford to sell in more places.

loans.use: To buy more cassava to sell

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en:
Donathile is 40 years old and is married with six children, two of whom are twins. Her children range from 4 to 14 years old and four of them are in school. Her husband is a farmer and, together, they afford health insurance for the whole family.

Donathile sells cassava in the local market and has been doing this business for five years. With the loan, she hopes to expand her business to include other produce in her store. She eventually hopes to work in larger markets and become self-sustaining.

loans.use: To expand her business to include other produce in her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Y. is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason and Mary supports him in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She has been through senior high school.

Mary sells smoked fish at Takoradi. Her loan will be used to buy extra fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to invest in the sale of plastic bowls.

loans.use: To buy extra fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 51 years old and married with three children, ages 12, 15, and 22. Two of her children are still in school and one has graduated. Her husband is a farmer. Together they have purchased health insurance for the whole family.

Marie sells cassava in the local market. With the loan she hopes to increase the amount of cassava she sells.

With the profits, Marie plans to buy and sell cattle. She also plans to broaden the types of produce she sells. She will strive to pay off her loan and be able to qualify for larger loans in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cassava to sell

loans.name: Blas

texts.es: Blas, de 46 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen 4 hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tiene propia casa a base de madera. La clave de su éxito radicó en la creatividad y honestidad que tenia con cada uno de sus clientes, es por ello que su producto de cacao es bien cotizado en su valle, además sus compradores está satisfecho por la calidad del producto que los ofrece y fruto de ello es que percibe buenos ingresos económicos. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha, tiene a cargo de sus peones, para le facilitar la extracción y selección de cacao, en el que serán vendidos en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola para seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes, en efecto mejorar su condición de vida. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además está comprometido con su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en comprar terrenos de cultivos, con la finalidad de que siga apostando en la actividad agrícola, a su vez pueda producir a mayor escala.
texts.en:
Blas, age 46, lives with his partner and their 4 school-aged children. Together, they live in the community of Villa Quintiarina, in the beautiful forests of the Cusco area, where they have their own house made of wood. The key to Blas' success lies in the creativity and honesty he displays with all of his customers. For this reason, his product, cacao [cocoa], is purchased at a good price in his valley. In addition, his buyers are satisfied with the quality of the product he offers them, and thanks to this, he earns a good income. He normally works on his own, but he sometimes receives help from his wife and his children. However, during the harvest season, he assigns work to laborers, who facilitate the harvest and sorting of the cacao, which will be sold to the wholesale centers in his community. His plan for the future is to keep expanding his agricultural production so that he can continue to satisfy his customers and thus improve his standard of living. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he promises to faithfully comply with his payment obligations. He is likewise committed to his communal bank. With the loan he is requesting, he will invest in buying agricultural land, so that he can continue his focus on agricultural work and at the same time start producing on a larger scale.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying land to increase his cacao production

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy K. is married and has two children. She has received junior high education.

Mercy sells ladies’ underwear at Takoradi and assists her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for the family. She will use the loan to purchase more ladies’ wear to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ladies' wear to sell

loans.name: Caritas

texts.en:
Caritas is a 51-year-old-widow and mother of seven children ranging in age from 7 to 28 years old. Three of her children are in school, including one who is in college. Though a mother of seven, she is able to afford health insurance for the entire family.

Caritas is a farmer who grows eggplants, tomatoes, and bell peppers for sale, and she also sells produce grown by other local farmers. She plans to use the loan to increase the amount she buys from local farmers, intending to invest the profits in her business. Eventually Caritas hopes to build a store from which to sell her items, and in the meantime strives to pay off her loans and qualify for larger loan amounts in the future.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. smokes fish to sell at Takoradi. She has received junior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an electronic welder and she responsibly supports him in the general welfare of the home.

Mary has been selling smoked fish for a reasonable time now. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Milce Raquel

texts.es:
Milce tiene 32 años. Ella es propietaria de un bar-copetín ubicado en el domicilio de sus padres. Ella trabajó desde pequeña en la venta de ensaladas de frutas con su madre y su tía.
Ahora, después de haber recibido su titulo profesional se dispuso a  montar su negocio para poder trabajar con sus padres en la seguridad de su casa.
Necesita de este crédito para culminar un sector de la construcción, que podrá utilizar como comedor. 
 En el futuro desea comprar para su terreno y a la larga poder construir una vivienda. 
Ella desea brindar el mayor bienestar a sus padres, pues gracias a ellos pudo obtener su titulo profesional.
texts.en:
Milce is 32. She is the owner of a bar and snack shop that is located in her parents' home. She has worked since she was a young girl selling fruit salads with her mother and aunt. Now, after having received her professional title, she prepared to start her own business so she could work with her parents in the safety of their home. She needs this loan to finish the area that is under construction, which she will use as the dining area. In the future, she hopes to buy her own land so she can build a home. She hopes to offer the best well-being to her parents. Thanks to them, she was able to get her professional title.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment to finish the construction of her snack bar

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi O. is divorced and has a child. Esi has been educated up to the junior high level.

Esi sells smoked fish at Takoradi and uses her earning from her sales to feed and educate her family as well as to pay utility bills.

Esi will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo, de 49 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen tres hijos. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propio techo a base de madera. Para llegar hasta hoy, tuvo que pasar muchos desafíos en su camino, Cirilo reconoce que el factor importante radica en la calidad y al buen servicio de atención al cliente, es por ello que cuenta con clientes que recurren a su establecimiento, que es una panadería.  Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja, pero en tiempo de vacaciones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y su punto de venta esta ubicado cerca de la plazuela de su comunidad. Su rutina diaria es a partir de las 5:00 de la  mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche, sin embargo tiene el anhelo de tener librería, con el fin  de que pueda diversificar su cartera de clientes y del mismo modo pueda aumentar sus ingresos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando durante las fechas pactadas, además está satisfecho con banco comunal, debido a las buenas decisiones que se toman. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima e ingredientes para abastecerse durante la producción del pan y el resto servirá para implementar su local con otros productos.
texts.en:
Cirilo, who is 49 years old, lives with his wife and their three children. They live in the community of Villa Quintiarina, located in the “ceja de la selva” area (the intersection of the Andean dry highlands and the Amazonian rainforests) in Peru. He owns a home at the edge of the forest. He has had to overcome many challenges to get where he is today. Cirilo knows that quality and a commitment to customer service are important factors for his business. Because of this, he has loyal clients that shop at his bakery frequently. He usually works with his wife, but during vacations, his children also help. His bakery is located near the main square in his community. His daily routine begins at 5 in the morning and ends at 9 at night. His dream is to own a bookstore to enable him to diversify his clientele and increase his income. This is Cirilo’s fifth loan with MFP, and he is committed to continuing to make his repayments on time. He is satisfied with his community bank because of their favorable policies. With this loan, Cirilo plans to invest in the purchase of raw materials and ingredients to make bread. He will also invest the loan to stock his business with other products.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients to make break and other products for his bakery

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en:
Theresah N. sells maize at Takoradi. She has not received any form of education. She is a widow and takes care of a child, being responsible for her child’s safety, security and health.

Theresah’s loan will be used to buy more maize to sell. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
La señora Mirian C.  esta casada con el Sr.Lorenzo López ,ellos tienen un hijo mayor .
Mirian  se dedica a la confección de   prendas de vestir, ella confecciona exclusivamente  buzos y uniformes de  colegios , tiene dos  maquinas con las que  trabaja ,mientras que su marido trabaja como chofer de omnibus  ,tiene una buena clientela formada ya que hace bastante tiempo se dedica a dicha actividad.
Ella  necesita de este crédito para la compra de telas  en cantidad por los pedidos que tiene en esta temporada  ,en el futuro desea  contruir un salón y exhibir sus trabajos .
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirian C. is married to Mr. Lorenzo López, and they have an adult son. Mirian makes sweatshirts and uniforms for schools. She has two machines, which she works on while her husband works as a bus driver. She has a good clientele built through years of work. She needs this loan to buy fabric in bulk to fill this season’s orders. In the future, she wants to build a room to exhibit her products.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and lining

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena A. sells cassava and plantain at Takoradi market. She has been through junior high school and is married with three children. Her husband is a driver and Mena uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Mena will use the loan to purchase more cassava and plantain to sell and for distribution. With the new revenues from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava and plantain to sell and for distribution

loans.name: Andrea Concepcion

texts.es: Andrea De La Concepción tiene 47 años, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 23 años, que tiene este negocio por lo que su esposo no tenía trabajo una fuente de ingresos necesarias para su hogar, esto fue lo que la motivo a salir adelante con su pequeño medio de vida siempre se ha preocupado por su hijo para que pueda estudiar y proporcionarle lo más necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como cal, maíz, leña y bolsas. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrea de la Concepción is 47 years old. She makes and sells tortillas. She has owned this business for more than 23 years. Her husband doesn’t have a job, so this business is her family’s only source of income. As a result, she is motivated to go forward with her business. She has always concerned for her son, and she wants him to continue in school and will support him more if necessary. She will use this loan to buy raw materials, such as lime, corn, firewood, and bags. She dreams of improving her home and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials to make tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 2 doors and 1 window

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena K. prepares kenkey for sale at Takoradi. Mena has received senior high education. She is divorced and takes care of four children. She is responsible for the upkeep of the family.

Mena’s loan will be used to buy more maize to cook to distribute to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

To prepare her kenkey, Mena buys maize from the market and soaks it in enough water to soften it. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough from the milled wet corn and leaves it to prove (ferment and rise).

On the next day she divides the proved dough into two, uses one part for her firm half-cooked dough (she mixes it with water to get it in a porridge form and cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture) and mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough. She moulds it into balls and wraps the balls in corn husk. She then cooks them again until they become soft enough to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey and any other kind of meat or fish.

loans.use: To buy more maize to cook to distribute to her customers

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio, de 63 años de edad, está casado y tiene una hija, Nidia de 12 años. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Emilio recuerda que durante varios años se dedicaba ayudar a sus padres, sembrando y cosechando cacao, pero con el tiempo tuvo su propia parcela de chacra en donde que sus padres le obsequiaron. Desde entonces empezó a trabajar en ello, produciendo cacao, asimismo se relacionaba con los compradores, por le que dio buen resultado la actividad que realiza. En la actualidad su producto de cacao está posicionado, y sus ventas se mantienen constantes, debido a la calidad y a la entrega eficaz que realiza con cada uno de sus clientes. Emilio trabaja con un peón, para que le facilite el cuidado de sus plantaciones de cacao y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Paralelamente a esta actividad, tiene un restaurante donde expende comida hacia el público en general, negocio que esta a cargo su esposa. Su plan a futuro es acondicionar su restaurante, introduciendo nuevas mesa, sillas, equipos con la finalidad de que dar comodidad a sus clientes, de esa forma aumente sus ventas de manera considerable. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además todos los socios que conforman en su banco comunal, son responsables en los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas, carnes, verduras, ingredientes, para que pueda continuar preparando sus potajes típicos de la selva que gustan de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Emilio is 63 years old. He is married and has one daughter, Nidia, who is 12 years old. They live together in the community of Villa Quintiarina, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where he has his own home built of wood. Emilio recalls that during a number of years he helped his parents, planting and harvesting cacao. Eventually he had his own farm plot that his parents left to him. Since then, he has worked the land, producing cacao as well as getting to know the buyers, which has produced good results. Currently his cacao product is well positioned and he has constant sales, due to the quality and the efficient work he performs for each of his customers. Emilio works with a laborer, who helps care for his cacao plants, and his daily routine is from 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening. He also has a restaurant where he sells tipical meals to the general public, which his wife runs. His plan for the future is to remodel his restaurant, adding new tables, chairs and equipment in order to provide greater comfort to his customers and, in this way, increase his sales considerably. This is his eighth loan with MFP, and he promises to continue meeting all of his payment obligations. Moreover all of the members who make up his communal bank are responsible with their payments. He will use this loan to purchase drinks, meat, vegetables, and ingredients so that he can continue preparing the typical jungle stews that his clients like.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and products to prepare typical stews

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal es empleado publico en la Policia; la esposa trabaja como empleada domestica; tienen un hijo, su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona de San Roque de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito que solicita será utilizado en la compra de cemento y ladrillo para refaccionar su vivienda y construir dos habitaciones  pues actualmente viven en una sola habitación.
Es el Cuarto crédito con IMPRO y el segundo via Kiva.
texts.en:
Vidal is a public employee with the Police. His wife works as a housekeeper. They have one son. They live in the Zona de San Roque in the city of El Alto. The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase cement and bricks to refurbish his home and to construct two rooms, as the family currently lives in a single room. This is his fourth loan with IMPRO and the second with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement and bricks to construct two rooms in his home, in order to live more comfortably.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua E. is a widow taking care of five dependents. She has been through junior high school.

Ekua sells salted fish, popularly and locally called “kako”, at Takoradi and uses her income in the general upkeep of her home. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to salt and sell.

With the new profits from her extended business, Ekua plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to salt and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
El señor Jhonny V. E. conviviente con la señora María Eledey Nogales más de 8 años, viven en Colomi zona urbana tienen 2 hijos dependientes de 1 año y de 6 años que estudia en nivel primaria, 

El señor nos comenta que mas antes se migraron a España lo cual no les fue bien, de tal modo se volvieron con lo poco que han ganado, se compraron un lote de terreno mas una construcción que esta a medias, razón que ellos se aproximaron a nuestras oficinas a solicitar un préstamo para hacer terminar la construcción de su vivienda para vivir más cómodos, ahora el señor Jhonny se dedica al servicio de transporte diario de Colomi hacia Cbba  y de Cbba hacia Colomi, la esposa realiza artesanías de tejido, ambos con las actividades a la cual se dedican piensan salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para tener una vida mejor a futuro, que sus hijos estudien y ganen una profesión.
texts.en:
Jhonny V. E. has lived with his common law wife María Eledey Nogales for more than 8 years. They live in the urban area of Colomi. They have 2 dependent children, a 1 year old and a 6 year old who is in elementary school. Jhonny said that they previous emigrated to Spain, which did not go well, so they returned with the little they had earned and purchased a parcel of land and a dwelling that is partially finished. They have approached us to request a loan to complete the construction of their home in order to live more comfortably. Jhonny provides daily transportation service from Colomi to Cbba and from Cbba to Colomi. His wife produces textile crafts. With these activities they hope to improve their income in order to have a better life in the future, and for their children to go to school and have a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of the family home

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Guadalupe H. S. tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su hija, por las mañanas doña Guadalupe se levanta muy temprano para preparar las golosinas y venderlas a los vecinos de su residencia,  tiene 5 años de realizar este tipo de actividad y en las tardes se prepara para salir a vender la ropa en las aldeas y colonias aledañas a San Lorenzo, es una persona que trabaja mucho para sacar adelante
a su familia.
 
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en mas mercaderia para lograr obtener mayores ganancias.
 
su mayor sueño es ver graduada a su hija de la universidad.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe H. S. is 58 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her daughter. Each morning Guadalupe rises very early to prepare her sweets to sell to her neighbors. She’s been doing this for five years and in the evenings she goes out to sell clothing in the villages and areas surrounding San Lorenzo. She is a person who works hard to move her family ahead. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in more merchandise so that she can generate more income. Her greatest dream is to see her daughter graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. sells provisions at Takoradi. She has been through senior high school. She is married to a photographer and has four children. With the help of her husband she is able to take good care of the family.

Adwoa’s loan will be used to buy extra provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to establish another shop at a different locality.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto, de 44 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene  dos hijas. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de adobe. Hace un buen tiempo atrás, Gilberto trabajaba para un productor de café, de lo cual recibía una remuneración justa, pero con el pasar de los años, tuvo que dejar trabajar de forma dependiente, para empezar con su propio negocio. Desde entonces produce y comercializa café y cacao, por  que le está dando buenos resultados, por ello se siente muy contento con el trabajo que realiza. Cuenta además con el de su familia, pero en época de siembra y cosecha contrata peones, que le facilitan la extracción de sus productos. Su plan a futuro es seguir con la agricultura, por lo que necesita comprar más terrenos de cultivo con el propósito de aumentar su producción agrícola. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente fortalecido con su grupo comunal, ya que le  brinda muchos beneficios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de producto de cacao y café de otros productores, para completar el pedido pendiente que tiene con sus compradores potenciales.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 44 years old and lives in the Villa Quintiaria community, in an adobe house, along with his wife and two daughters. The community is located within the tropical Peruvian jungle. In the past Gilberto worked raising coffee, where he received a fair salary, but after some time he decided to stop working for someone else and started his own business. Since then he’s been raising and selling coffee and cacao. Things have been going well for him, so he feels happy with his work. He gets some help from his family, but during the harvest season he hires workers to help with the harvest. He plans to continue farming and needs to buy more farmland so that he can increase his production. This will be his sixth loan through MFP and he is committed to making all of his payments. He also feels empowered by his communal group because it provides him with many benefits. He will use the money from this loan to buy cacao and coffee to complete orders he has from his potential customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Coffee and cacao

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for construction materials and expenses (corrugated metal roofing sheets, cement, labor)

loans.name: Asata

texts.en:
Asata I. operates a provisions shop at Takoradi and has been in this trade for some time now. She will use the loan to purchase extra provisions to fill her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a house.

Asata is married to a driver and has a child. She uses the earnings she generates from her sales to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She has been through senior high education.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to fill her shop

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 45 años de edad, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. Jorge se siente súper orgulloso, ya que gracias al negocio agrícola le ayuda en el sustento de su familia. Hoy el café que produce tiene mucha demanda en su localidad y en otras zonas. Normalmente trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita de sus peones para que le faciliten la extracción y selección de café. Usualmente labora de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 del a mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde y su punto de venta lo realiza en lo centros de acopio de su localidad. Sus planes a futuro es cultivar cacao, con la finalidad de que pueda obtener mayores ingresos. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal, por la solidaridad que existe en cada uno de ellos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, para que de esa manera lo dé un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Jorge is 45 years old. He is married and has four children. They live together in the community of Villa Quintiarina, located in the beautiful jungle of the Cusco department, where he has his own house built of wood. Jorge feels very proud that with his agricultural business he helps provide for his family. The coffee he produces is in high demand in the area and in others. He usually works together with his wife, but during harvest time he needs workers to help him with harvesting and processing the coffee. He usually works Monday through Saturday, from 7:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening and he sells at the local collection centers. His plan for the future is to plant cacao, with the goal of increasing his income. This is his eighth loan with MFP, and he promises to continue complying with the timeframe for repayments. He is also grateful to his communal bank for the solidarity that each of the members shows. With the loan he is requesting he plans to buy inputs and fertilizer, so that he can adequately care for his coffee farms.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer so he can improve the quality of coffee he produces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, clothing, and handbags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products to increase her inventory

loans.name: San Ramón Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchadoras nace hace más de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo, en estos más de cuatro años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
Una de la integrantes es la señora Reinalda A. quien es peluquera y atiende a sus clientes en un  salón que posee en su casa, y al mismo tiempo ofrece lenceria en su peluqueria.
Asi ella logra obtener buenos ingresos con las actividades que realiza, solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas de trabajo para su peluqueria.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Luchadores" was formed more than 2 years ago thanks to the leadership and support of another communal bank that was working in the same place. This group is from San Lorenzo, and as a result of intense work over 4 years they have grown both socially and economically; they are recognized in their area as very hardworking women. One of the members is Reinalda A., who is a hairdresser and serves her customers in a salon that she has in her house. She also offers lingerie for sale in her beauty salon. Reinalda makes a good income from these activities; she requests a loan to buy equipment for her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her beauty salon such as hair dyes, brushes, hair dryers, hair creams and oils, and other items

loans.name: Daisy Xioamara

texts.es:
la señora Daisy Xiomara I. tiene 37 años de edad,  es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella,  uno de sus hijos esta en los estados unidos y le ayuda economicamente.
su actividad actual es la compra y venta de productos de consumo popular y granos basicos, tiene tres años de realizar esta actividad.
 
las ventas las realiza de lunes a domingo al por mayor y al detalle, sus clientes son las personas que visitan el mercado, Daisy a tenido mucho éxito en sus ventas por su atencion a sus clientes.
 
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlos en la compra de granos basicos y abarroteria para surtir un poco mas su negocio.
 
su mayor sueño tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Daisy Xiomara I. is 37 years old, she is a single mother and has three children who depend on her. One of her children is in the United States and helps her financially. Her current business is buying and selling popular consumer products and basic grains, and she has been doing this for three years. She sells Monday to Sunday wholesale and retail, her customers are people who visit the market. Daisy has had a lot of success in her sales because of her attention to her customers. The loan will be used to invest in basic grains and groceries to supply her business a little more. Her greatest dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase batteries, cold drinks, corn and wheat flour, tortillas, toothpaste, toilet paper, soup, pasta, beans, rice, butter, oil, bread, cookies, confectionary, churros, juice, chilli.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials (tin roofing, cement, wood, bolts)

loans.name: Melida Santana

texts.es:
la sra. Melida Santana M. es viuda y vive en San Lorenzo Valle desde hace 26 años, tiene casa propia, no tiene dependientes, todos sus hijos ya estan casados y recibe ayuda de ellos.
Melida se dedica al negocio de pulperia, tiene buena experiencia para tratar a los clientes,  sus ventas son de lunes a domingo y por estar ubicada en una zona de comercio sus ventas son muy buenas.
 
doña Melida Santana es una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus obligaciones, el credito lo utilizara en la compra de abarroteria y refrescos al por mayor y asi obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Melida Santana M. is a widow who has lived in San Lorenzo Valle for 26 years. She has her own home and lives without dependents. All of her children are married and she receives help from them. Melida has a general store business. She's very experienced with customer relations. Her store is open from Monday to Sunday and because it's located in a commercial area her sales are very good. Melida Santana is a very responsible person and punctual with her obligations. She will use the loan to buy grocery items and soft drinks wholesale in order to make a better profit.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of  soft drinks, juices, bread, beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, dairy products, churros, sardines, toilet paper, batteries, lights, soaps, pastas, sauces, cold cuts, salt, condiments, tortillas, cookies, candy

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio, de 36 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en la hermosa selva cusqueña, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de adobe. En un inicio, el negocio agrícola que tenía no le daba buenos réditos, sin embargo y con el tiempo pudo superar tal problema; en la actualidad su producto de cacao es pedido por lo grandes mayoristas debido a la calidad que ofrece, dando como resultado la obtención de ganancias económicas, de esa manera pueda sostener a su familia. Es por ello que trata de estar en su chacra labrando y cuidando sus cultivos de cacao conjuntamente con su esposa, solo que en tiempo de cosecha necesita de sus peones para que de esa manera puedan facilitarlo en la extracción y selección de su producto agrícola. Normalmente su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad, y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Su plan a futuro es abrir una tienda para así obtener nuevos ingresos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando durante las fechas pactadas, además hace hincapié al buen desempeño que tiene su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono para dar  el cuidado adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Julio is 36 years old and married with one son who attends school. The family lives together in the beautiful jungle near Cusco, located at the top of the Peruvian jungle zone. They have their own home there made from adobe. Initially, the agricultural business that Julio had wasn't bringing in enough money. However, after some time he was able to turn things around. Today, the largest wholesalers ask for the cocoa he grows due to the quality he offers, and this has enabled Julio to earn the income he needs to support his family. He runs his small business and cultivates his cocoa crops together with his wife, but during harvest time he needs to hire additional laborers. Julio usually sells his cocoa in the central markets of his community, and his daily routine is to work from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening. His future plans include opening his own shop to generate more income. This will be Julio's third loan with MFP, and he commits to continue making his payments on time. He also emphasizes the good work that the communal bank does. With the loan he is requesting, Julio will purchase supplies and fertilizer needed to give his cocoa crops adequate care.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilzer needed to take care of his cocoa crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing for her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Katy Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Katy del Rosario B., tiene 31 años de edad, casada y con 2 hijos adolecentes, que se dedican al estudio, habitan en el Barrio Laureles Sur, un conocido lugar de la ciudad de Managua por la delincuencia que amenaza a los habitantes que ahí moran, ellos tienen un pequeño negocio el cual es una venta de abarrotes, productos de uso diario y de casa, fue hace mas de 6 años que con apoyo de su esposo lograron instalar este negocio el cual hoy le genera un buen ingreso a la familia, ellos se sienten provechosos de la buenas ventas que genera el negocio, y es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo con la intención de incrementar la mercadería que se ofrecen en la pulpería, esta inversión le permitirá mejores condiciones económicas con el objetivo de financiar los estudios universitarios a sus hijos, y la tranquilidad de favorecer a su desarrollo diario.
texts.en:
Katy del Rosario B. is 31 years old, married and has two teen-aged children who attend school. They live in the Lureles neighborhood, an area in Managua, known for the crime that harasses its residents. [Katy] has a small business where she sells groceries, and daily use personal and household products. She started this business six years ago, with her husband’s support, and now it generates a good income for the family. They feel privileged with the good sales that the business generates. For this reason they are asking for this loan, in order to be able to increase the amount of merchandise that they have to sell. This investment will help give them better financial conditions and will allow them to pay for their children’s university educations, as well as provide favorable conditions for their development.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “DINAMICO”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 63 años D. edad y la socia es Viuda,  y ella se dedica a al comercio minorista, La socia tine su negocio D. compra y venta D. ropa, ella viaja cada 15 días o dependiendo a como le fue con su negocio a la ciudad D. Lima, ella va a las fábricas y en especial compra polos D. algodón, conocedora D. que Perú tiene el mejor algodón en el mundo, la socia trae polos, medias, ropas interiores y demás, para la venta en la ciudad del Cusco. La socia después D. la muerte D. su esposo a solventado todos los gastos del hogar con este pequeño negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y traer para la venta.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the communal bank called "Dinamico". She lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco, Peru. Hilda is 63 years old and widowed. To earn a living, she runs a small business buying and selling clothing. Every 15 days or so, Hilda travels to the city of Lima where she goes to the factories that specialize in cotton shirts. It is well known that Peru has some of the finest cotton in the world. Hilda brings shirts, socks, underwear and other cotton products to sell in the city of Cusco. After her husband died, Hilda was able to settle all of the household expenses with the income she earned from her small business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise to sell. Hilda values and appreciates the loans she's been given which enabled her to grow her business. She is committed to making the payments and complying with the payment terms.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her small business buying and selling cotton products.  The income from her small business has enabled her to support herself since the death of her husband.

loans.name: Santos Trinidad

texts.es:
la señora S. Trinidad F. S. tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Jose Estanislao Flores, dependen de ellos dos hijos.  el señor Jose se dedica a la comercializacion de aceite para fabricar biodisel y la señora S. vende golosinas y refrescos en una glorieta, sus productos los vende con los vecinos y amigos de la comunidad.
 
S. tiene que levantarse muy tremprano para preparar las golosinas,  esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años,  tambien vende tortillas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar refrescos y los materiales para preparar las golosinas. 
S. vive con su familia en la comunidad de Laure Abajo, en donde radican desde hace unos 14 años, siempre se a dedicado al comercio,  actividad con la cual a sacado adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. Trinidad F. S. is 45 years old, married to Mr. Jose Estanislao Flores, and has two dependent children. Jose makes a living by marketing oil to be made into biodiesel fuel, and S. sells candy and soft drinks near a traffic circle. They sell their products with their neighbors and friends in the community. S. has to get up very early to prepare the candy, which she has been doing for 2 years. She also sells tortillas.
