Juana, 49, lives in her own home with her three children. She has raised cows and bulls for over 10 years. Every day she extracts milk to sell to her neighbors or to firms that make cheese. Additionally, she strives to feed her bulls well and after a period of three months sells them at a price higher than the original price she paid for them or she uses them for plowing the fields. Sometimes her children help her with the chores; they cut the grass and feed the cattle or sell the milk. What she enjoys most about her work is that she can manage her time to tend to her family and that it is independent, profitable work. Because of this, she wishes to increase her herd size in order to increase milk production. This is her 5th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial support because she has always been responsible with her repayments. In addition, she is glad to be part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible and very mutually supportive people. She is grateful to all those people who will fund the loan she is requesting for it will be very useful for her business. She will use the requested funds to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals and to buy a young calf.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals and to buy a calf.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca tiene 60 años, Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y granos básicos. Por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos es su mayor fuente de ingreso para su familia, hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos, por lo que tiene una gran variedad de clientes mantener estos negocios no ha sido fácil, pues la situación económica que atraviesa el país. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisas, faldas y vestidos también arroz, aceite entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca is 60 and she works selling clothing and basic grains. She began this business more than 11 years ago because she is always looking for a better way to increase her income for her family. She is always worried about getting more earnings and to have many types of customers in this business hasn't been easy. The economic situation has had an impact across the country. This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as pants, shirts, skirts, and dresses as well as rice, oil and more.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Exodo Alejandro

texts.es:
Labora para Matecsa como guarda de seguridad, es acompañado con 3 personas a su cargo 2 niños en edad escolar y su compañera de vida, se encarga en la empresa de la vigilancia del lugar resguardando los bienes de la Institución.
Durante he tenido créditos con CEPRODEL, he logrado dar una mejor comodidad a mi familia y poder asegurar a mis hijos durante el día y la noche ya que en este país lo más importante es asegurar la vivienda, por el peligro y la delincuencia.
Por tanto agradezco a CEPRODEL, por su apoyo a mejorar mis condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Exodo works for Matecsa (a company that produces metal construction materials) as a security guard. He has 3 dependents: 2 school-aged children and his life partner. In his company he is in charge of monitoring the premises, guarding the assets of the institution. Over the time that he has taken loans with CEPRODEL, he has managed to provide better comfort for his family and make his house more secure during the day and night for his children, since in this country there is a risk from crime. For this reason he is grateful to CEPRODEL for their support, which has enabled him to improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make improvements to his house; to buy construction materials

loans.name: Bertha Rosa

texts.es:
Bertha Rosa Díaz B. tiene 48 años y vive en el barrio Los Almendros de Soledad,  con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 20 años.
Tiene un negocio que consiste en  la venta de productos como ropa artículos para cocina y perfumería en general, mediante guías especializadas, que le suministra un proveedor y también adquiere a través de la compra directa en el centro de Barranquilla. Comenzó vendiendo por catálogos artículos para cocina y perfumería en general, negocio   referido por su vecina conocedora de su  capacidad como emprendedora y también porque siendo su mayor fortaleza la confección,  la inexistencia de un capital de trabajo para poner en practica este potencial, hizo que se inclinara por la venta de mercancía, teniendo en cuenta  la facilidad de trabajar con intermediarios a crédito; así fue como inició con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace mas de 10 años cuando viajaba a Maicao, pero suspendió y  por eso Credikiva es su   segundo financiamiento, porque necesita  con una  parte del crédito comprar una vitrina vertical para exhibir la mercancía y la otra para comprar ropa y algunos electrodomésticos menores  preparándose así para el segundo semestre del año que es una temporada donde hay repunte en las ventas. Su sueño es tener adecuado su negocio con un local y todo lo que se requiere para hacer una muy buena y agradable exhibición de sus productos de manera permanente.
texts.en:
Bertha Rosa Díaz B., 48, lives in the Los Almendros de Soledad neighborhood with her spouse and two children who are 14 and 20 years of age. Her business consists in sale of clothing, kitchen items and cosmetics via catalogue orders that she places with a distributor but she also buys direct from a market in downtown Barranquilla. She started out selling catalogue kitchen and cosmetic items, a business to which she was referred by a neighbor who recognized her enterprising capacity. Her greatest talent, however, is clothes-making but, the lack of funds to launch this potential, caused her to lean toward merchandise sales since working with middlemen on credit was a possibility. This is how she started with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo over 10 years ago when she would go to Maicao. However, she stopped doing that and now the Kiva loan is her second financing because she needs part of the funds to buy a vertical display case to exhibit her merchandise and part of it is to buy clothes and small home appliances to prepare for the second semester of the year which is when sales peak. Her dream is to have a locale that is well equipped with everything necessary for a good, permanent and attractive display of products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Part is to buy a vertical display case to exhibit the merchandise and part to buy clothing and a few small home appliances to prepare for the second semester of the year which is when there is a peak in sales.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos L. H. tiene la joven edad de 26 años, vive acompañado de su pareja, tienen un hijo recién nacido, su esposo se dedica a vender frutas y verduras y es el soporte económico de su familia, ella le apoya en su trabajo y realiza las actividades de su hogar. 
El alza en los precios de los productos ha disminuido el volumen de las ventas, razón que obstaculiza los planes para remodelar el tramo donde tiene localizado su negocio, con el crédito realizará  la compra de materiales de construcción tales como zinc, bloques, cemento, arena, hierro, etc. Espera le apoyen a mejorar las condiciones de su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y favorecer a sus niveles de vida y sobre todo las de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos L. H. is 26 years young and lives with his wife and newborn son. He sells fruits and vegetables and provides the family’s financial support. His wife helps him in his work and also cares for the household. The increase in prices has decreased his sales, which has created an obstacle for his plans to remodel the stall from where he runs his business. He will use the money from this loan to buy building materials, such as zinc metal sheeting, cinder blocks, cement, sand, iron bars, etc. He wants to improve the conditions of his business so that he can increase his income and quality of life, especially for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business location improvement

loans.name: Paula Benita

texts.es: Paula Benita tiene la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 15 años que tiene esta actividad, por lo que inicialmente  su Mama se hacía cargo del negocio, con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido incrementando su mercadería, por lo que sus vecinos, amigos y familiares son sus clientes, pero Paula se esfuerza cada día más por mejorar el número de clientes. Por lo que siempre sueña con poner una tienda en donde sus clientes puedan apreciar todo lo que ella ofrece. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar ropa interior, cosméticos, calzado entre otras.
texts.en:
Paula Benita sells general merchandise. She has been in this line of work for over 15 years. At the beginning her mother was in charge of the business but as time has passed her stock has grown. Her customers are her neighbors, acquaintances and family members. Paula strives to increase her customer base daily. This is why she dreams with having a store where her customers can examine everything she has on offer. The funding will be used to buy underwear, cosmetics and shoes, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy underwear, cosmetics and shoes, among others.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
•	Labora para Matecsa, como guarda de seguridad, es un hombre casado  tiene dos hijos uno de edad escolar.
•	En los cuatro créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL he podido ir mejorando y ampliando mi casa poco a poca ya que los montos son de acuerdo a mi ingreso por tal razón se avanza progresivamente en la obra he logrado cambio de techo y hacer anexos que han permitido dar un poco de comodidad a mi familia.
texts.en:
He is employed by Matecsa (a building materials firm) as a security guard. He’s married and has two children, one of whom is school aged. With the four CEPRODEL loans he has had he has been able to gradually enlarge and improve his home since the loan amounts have been according to his income therefore progress on the house is gradual. He states that so far he has been able to replace the roof and build annexes that have provided a bit more comfort for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies for home improvement.

loans.name: Rafahela Yezenia

texts.es: Rafahela Yezenia tiene 29 años, es madre soltera con  1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar los servicios de costura, por lo que tiene muy buenos clientes y con una gran variedad, pues esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación pues ha sido de gran ayuda para su actividad. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de hilos, tijeras, agujas, telas alfileres entre otros actualmente tiene bastante encargos que tiene que cumplirlos es por eso que solicita este financiamiento. Por lo que sueña con seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Rafahela Yezenia, 29, is a single mother of a son who is under her care. She is a seamstress. She has a variety of good customers. This isn’t her first loan with the Foundation for it has been of great help to her in the past. The current loan request is to buy thread, scissors, needles, pins and fabric, among other items. She needs the funds because she has several pending orders to fill and needs supplies to do so. Her dream is to continue to grow in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Antonio labora para MATECSA en el área de producción elaborando adoquines.
Estos créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL han sido utilizado para compra de materiales de construcción, cin , perlin, cemento, hierro.
Las obras han consistido en mantenimiento y reparación de la vivienda ya que estaba en muy mal estado esto se ha venido mejorando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio is employed by MATECSA (a building materials firm) in the production department making paving stones. He has used CEPRODEL loans to buy building materials like: zinc metal sheeting, edging, cement, iron rods. The projects have been home maintenance and repair in that it was in very poor state and he has been making gradual improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies for home improvement.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny tiene  38 años, vive con su esposo  y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 20 años trabaja vendiendo hamburguesas, en su carrito, lugar donde prepara estos platillos, todas las tardes y las noches. Le agrada trabajar en su negocio porque le permite acomodar sus horarios con las demás actividades que realiza entre ellas como la crianza de animales y la agricultura, además de que disfruta cocinar porque es su pasatiempo. Para el futuro planea tener mejores herramientas para sus trabajos como mesas y sillas nuevas. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes, como: aceite, envases descartables, entre ellas, platos y cubiertos.
texts.en:
Fanny, 38, lives with her husband and four children in her own home. For over 20 years she has worked selling hamburgers from her cart where she prepares these dishes every afternoon and evening. She enjoys her business because it allows her to arrange her work schedule in harmony with her other duties like raising animals and farming. Besides, she enjoys cooking because that’s her hobby. For the future, she’d like to have better work tools like tables and new chairs. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial support for she has always been punctual with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all its members are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she is requesting which will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy ingredients like: cooking oil, disposable containers such as plates and cutlery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and cutlery.

loans.name: Yaneth Del Socorro

texts.es: La  Sra. Yaneth del Socorro S. Q. ella es comerciante se dedica al negocio  de Granos Básico, Gaseosa,    ella tiene  nueve  años de dedicarse a este negocio, su negocio lo tiene instalado en la casa de habitación es Casada actualmente tiene Tres niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  nueve  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para ampliar  en mercadería su negocio y mejorarlo los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia
texts.en:
Mrs. Yaneth del Socorro S. Q. is a grocer; she sells basic grains, soft drinks, etc. She has been in this line of work for 9 years. Her store is located in her home. She has three, school aged children. She has had 9 loans with CEPRODEL that she has used to enlarge her stock of merchandise in her store and to make improvements to it which have been of great benefit for her because this has led to improved living conditions for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Izaias Ezequiel

texts.es:
El señor Izasis A. R. labora para la asociación  futuro de la niñez (afunic) como instructor en los talleres brindando enseñanza a la juventud.
Es divorciado tiene tres hijos a su cargo en edad escolar.
Los créditos que ha obtenido en CEPRODEL han sido de gran impacto en su familia ya que con el primer crédito, realizo reparaciones en su hogar, el segundo fue utilizado para resolver asuntos de pagos de aranceles escolares y el tercero es el ultimo obtenido este será de gran utilidad ya que actualmente necesita realizar exámenes de la vista y compra de lentes.
texts.en:
Izasis A. R. works for the Association for the Future of Children (Afunic) as an instructor in youth workshops. He is divorced and cares for three school-aged children. The loans that he has obtained through CEPRODEL have had a huge impact on his family. With his first loan he was able to make some repairs on his home and with the second loan he paid off outstanding school fees. He will be able to make good use of this third loan as he needs to have an eye examination and purchase a pair of glasses.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use, eye examination and purchase of glasses

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
la señora Deysi M. vive en la aldea Laure Abajo en San Lorenzo, tiene 11 años de vivir en dicho lugar, ahi se establecio junto con su familia,  ya que el huracan mitch le arrebato su casa y a tenido que luchar para poder crear nuevamente su hogar.
 
Deisy se dedica a la comercializacion de productos de la canasta familiar y tambien vende refrescos.
su negocio lo aperturo hace unos tres años.
Deisy es una persona muy humilde y honesta, vende sus productos en su casa en donde los vecinos compran jabon, cuajada, queso, paletas, ropa y plasticos a demas vende flores para la epoca de el dia de los santos. 
 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar refrescos al por mayor de varios tamaños, 3 litros, 2.5 litros, 2 litros, 1.5 litros, 1.25 litros, 1/2 litros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Deisy M. lives in the village of Laure Abajo in San Lorenzo. She has lived there for 11 years. She settled there with her family after Hurricane Mitch destroyed her house. She has had to struggle since then to establish a new home. Deisy sells basic groceries and soft drinks. She opened her store about three years ago. Deisy is a very humble and honest person. She sells her products from home where her neighbors come to buy soap, cottage-cheese, cheese, popsicles, clothes, plastic items. She also sells flowers for the Saint Days. She will use the funds to buy soft drinks at wholesale in 3, 2.5, 2, 1.5, 1.25 and 0.5 liter sizes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Félix Pedro García labora para la UNICA (universidad Católica de Nicaragua).como carpintero se encarga de realizar reparaciones y elaboraciones de todo tipo de artículos de carpintería en la universidad
Es casado tiene un niño .Este crédito lo solicita a CEPRODEL para realizar gastos personales comprar una cocina para uso personal y solucionar un problema en la famiia.
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Pedro García works for the UNICA (Catholic University of Nicaragua) as a carpenter. He does repairs and makes many different items as a carpenter in the university. He is married and has a son. This loan that he is requesting from CEPRODEL is for personal expenses: to buy a kitchen for his family and to solve a problem that they have have.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Use: To buy kitchen appliances that are needed for his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelia America

texts.es:
Nelia tiene 54 años de edad, es viuda y vive junto a su hija en el sector Tejedores del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que produce principalmente frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, el negocio se encuentra situado frente a un centro médico de la localidad al cual acuden personas de los caseríos situados alrededor de su centro poblado. El negocio es importante para ellos ya que les provee de productos de uso diario que no tienen al alcance de la mano. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Nelia trata de brindar un buen trato a sus clientes y también trata de ofrecerles productos de calidad, esto ha hecho que la demanda de su negocio vaya en aumento, para poder satisfacerla ha creído conveniente adquirir mas productos, para lograr este objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Nelia es una mujer luchadora y empeñosa, ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de haber perdido a su esposo y a su hijo, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Nelia is 54 years old, widowed and lives with her daughter in the Tejedores sector of the agricultural district of Tambogrande, whose main production is fruit for export. Tambogrande belongs to the province of Pirua which is located in the region of the same name, three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Nelia sells groceries and other essential items from a store which she has set up in her home. She uses the income from the store to sustain her family.The store is situated in front of a medical centre in her community which people come to from the surrounding villages. The store is important for them as it provides them with products they can use on a daily basis that they would not have access to otherwise. Nelia aims to look after her customers and offer them quality products, which has resulted in an increase in demand for her products. To acquire more products and satisfy her customers, she has decided to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 700 nuevos soles. Nelia is a strong and hardworking woman who was able to carry on in spite of the loss of her husband and her son. Her neighbours and acquaintances in the community consider her to be peaceful and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and essential items.

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
Luisa R. es soltera tiene un hijo pequeño labora para LOTERIA NACIONAL como cajera su labor consiste en recibir efectivo producto de la venta de billetes de lotería.
De los dos préstamos obtenidos en CEPRODEL  he logrado mejorar algunos detalles como hacer el baño de mi casa y reparaciones en general.
Me siento contenta ya que poco a poco he ido dando respuestas a las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Luisa R. is single and has one small child. She works as a cashier for the national lottery. Her work consists of receiving cash proceeds from the sale of lottery tickets. She used her two previous loans from Kiva partner CEPRODEL to make some improvements to her home, such as building the bathroom in her home and making general repairs. Luisa feels happy because little by little she is managing to meet the needs of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials for making home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing construction materials: sand, cement, stone, and gravel.

loans.name: María Luzmila

texts.es:
La Señora María Luzmila T. es socia del banco comunal Cumbe, vive en el centro de la  parroquia Cumbe, esta parroquia es conocida por su exuberante vegetación y su  clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, mucha de su población joven a migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

La Señora María Luzmila se dedica desde muy joven a la agricultura produciendo variedad de hortalizas, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes y gallinas a los cuales los vende en su propia parroquia.

Doña María  tiene 50 años, es viuda hace 22 años y tiene 6 hijos, todos son mayores de edad y casados, cinco de ellos viven de manera independiente y solo su último hijo es quien le acompaña y comparten los gastos del hogar, con el sacrificio de su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Se encuentra trabajando con los créditos de la fundación hace 6 años y le han beneficiado en la compra de animales y semillas para sus siembras,  su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de pollos para la cría, su meta es tener más animales para su negocio.
texts.en:
María Luzmila T. is a member of the Cumbe communal bank. She lives in the center of Cumbe parish. This parish is known for its lush vegetation and cold climate; its inhabitants make a living from ranching and farming, though much of the younger population has left in search of better jobs. María has made a living from farming since she was very young. She grows a variety of vegetables, and also earns money raising guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells within her parish. María is 50 years old, has been widowed for 22 years, and has 6 children. All of her children are adults and have married. Five of them live independently, while the last son lives with her and shares the household expenses. María has managed to build her own house through her own hard work. María has been working with loans from the foundation for 6 years and has used them to purchase animals and seeds for her plants. She will use her new loan to purchase chickens that she will raise. Her wish is to have more animals for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chickens to raise.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad y en este nuevo ciclo es la presidenta D. su Banco Comunal y lo que mas le agrada D. su Banco son las capacitaciones y el inventivo al ahorro, Margarita es casada y tiene 8 hijos D. los cuales solo uno le falta D. terminar la universidad.
Margarita tiene un recreo llamado el Amigo que esta ubicado en el centro D. la ciudad, en donD. venD. comida típica, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, mientras los demás días venD. menú, negocio que atienD. con la ayuda D. sus hijos.
Margarita solicita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. mesas y sillas.
Margarita sueña con mejorar su negocio, tener mas clientes y estar bien D. salud.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “Dignidad” (Dignity). She serves as president of her Communal Bank and is participating in her ninth loan cycle. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the training classes and the incentive to save. Margarita is married and has eight children, of whom only one failed to complete university.

She has a lounge called “El Amigo” (The Friend) located in the central part of the city. There she sells traditional food on Saturdays and Sundays. On other days she sells menu items. Her children help her with managing the business.

Margarita needs a loan of 3000 PEN to invest in the purchase of tables and chairs. She dreams of improving her business, attracting more customers, and maintaining good health.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Yoly

texts.es: Yoly tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 7 años se dedica a la compra y venta de reses, además diariamente vende la leche que extrae de sus vacas. Manifiesta que a pesar que su trabajo es muy sacrificado le es muy rentable a la vez, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Se siente muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza, por que le permite tener a toda su familia unida. En tanto los ingresos que recibe son rentables ya que sus vacas producen regular cantidad en litros de leche y sus animales  son de  una raza mejorada que permite venderlo a un buen precio en el mercado. Su deseo es tener un establo amplio donde pueda tener ganado vacuno. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de 2 pequeños toros para su establo.
texts.en:
Yoly is 28 years old and lives in her home with her husband and two children. For more than seven years, she has been buying and selling cattle. In addition, she sells milk extracted from her cows. Yoly says that her work is very profitable even though it requires a lot of sacrifice. She has the support of her husband. Yoly feels happy with the work she has accomplished since it has allowed her entire family to stay together. The income she generates is quite profitable because her cows produce a steady quantity of milk and the animals she sells at the market command a good price since they are of an improved breed. Her wish is to have a larger stable so that she can acquire more cattle.

This is her third loan MFP. Yoly is pleased to know that she has financial support and always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. She is glad to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. Yoly is grateful to the people who will be approving her loan request since it will help her advance her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of two small bulls to keep in her stable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two small bulls

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huarakaq que significa Abundancia en quechua.
Consuelo es casada y tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Consuelo es de profesión Odontóloga y tiene un consultorio en el centro de la ciudad en un local alquilado, para lo cual cuenta con 3 asistentes.
Consuelo necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales dentales.
Los sueños de Consuelo son crecer como empresa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the Communal Bank “Muchuy Huarakaq”, which means “Abundance” in Quechua. She is married and has three children enrolled in school. Consuelo is a dentist by profession and has an office in a rented location in the central part of the city. She has three assistants who work for her.

Consuelo needs a loan of 1050 PEN to invest in the purchase of dental supplies. She dreams of growing as a businesswoman and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dental supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Repair the roof of his house & pay off a previous home improvement loan

loans.name: Frida Marilu

texts.es:
Frida es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Frida tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, regalos, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Frida es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huarakaq que significa Abundancia en quechua, lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro, en este nuevo ciclo solicita un préstamo de 1050 soles para la compra de bebidas, leche, aceite.
Los sueños de Frida son ampliar su negocio, tener una ferretería y ayudar a sus hijos que culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Frida is married and has two children enrolled in school. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, gifts, and beverages. Frida manages her business every day.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Muchuy Huarakaq”, which means “Abundance” in Quechua. What she likes most about her Communal Bank is having the incentive to save. She is in her ninth loan cycle and requesting 1050 PEN to purchase beverages, milk, and oil.

Frida dreams of expanding her business, opening a hardware store, and helping her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages, milk, and oil

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es casada y tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando, Nancy tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huarakaq que significa Abundancia en quechua, lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro.
Nancy solicita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, verduras y azúcar.
Los sueños de Nancy son mejorar su negocio, ser mayorista y ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nancy is married and has three children enrolled in school. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meats. Nancy manages her business every day.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Muchuy Huarakaq”, which means “Abundance” in Quechua. What she likes most about her Communal Bank is having the incentive to save. Nancy is requesting a loan of 2100 PEN to invest in the purchase of rice, vegetables, and sugar.

Her dreams include improving her business, becoming a wholesaler, and helping her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, vegetables, and sugar

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La señora Juana Francisca tiene 57 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de manualidades y ropa por lo que tiene más de 5 años de tener esta actividad, este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza pues ha tenido muy buena experiencia. El sueño de Juana es mantener seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es el único medio de vida que tiene. Es una persona responsable y lleva al día sus cuotas. Es por eso que este financiamiento es para la compra de tijeras, telas, agujas, cobertores, hilos y algo de ropa.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Francisca is 57 years old. Her business involves producing and selling handicrafts and clothing, which she has been doing for more than five years. This is not the first loan she has obtained since she has plenty of experience.

Juana dreams of maintaining her business since it is the only livelihood that she has. She is a responsible person who makes sure that her payments are up to date. This loan will be used to buy scissors, fabric, needles, bedspreads, thread, and some clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase scissors, fabric, needles, bedspreads, thread, and clothing

loans.name: Angelita Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Angelita es una señora que tiene 3 años de trabajar con ceprodel ella tiene una comideria en su casa la cual está ubicada en la comarca la gloria de este municipio con este negocio y los prestamos que se la ha financiado ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos ya que le ha permitido ir aumentando su casa y lograr tener mejores condiciones para su negocio ya que cuando empezó solamente tenía dos mesas para atender a su clientela actualmente tiene alrededor de 8 mesas donde atiende un aproximado de unas 60 personas por día por lo que con sacrificio y esfuerzo ella  se ha superado
texts.en:
Sra. Angelita is a woman who has partnered with CEPRODEL for three years. She manages a diner out of her home located in the region of La Gloria. Through her business and with the loans she has received, Angelita has been able to improve her income. As a result, she has been able to expand her house and provide better conditions for her business. When she first started, she only had two tables for serving her customers. Now she has eight tables and is able to serve approximately 60 people each day through hard work and sacrifice.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bricks, cement, and iron to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Carmen

texts.es:
JACQUELINE DEL CARMEN J. S., trabaja como Aseadora en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.El va ha utilizar el dinero en cambio de techo y repellar su casa de habitación y así va adquiriendo su mejor nivel de vida .
Toda la plata que va trabajador  con Ceprodel  la va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para su hogar, va mejorar su hogar y va adquiriendo un mejor nivel de vida Y algunos gastos varios.
texts.en:
Jacqueline del Carmen J. S. works as a janitor at the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua. She plans to use this loan to replace the roof of her house and whitewash the walls, which will improve her standard of living.

All the money she received through her partnership with CEPRODEL has been used to buy construction materials to improve her home and to pay for a few expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the roof & whitewash the walls of her house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes tiene 44 años, su actividad económica es la venta de productos plásticos, se siente muy contenta por tener la oportunidad  de acceder a financiamientos.  Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio vendiendo de manera ambulante con el paso del tiempo con la ayuda de su Mama logro tener en su propio establecimiento en el mercado, por lo que se levanta muy temprano desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde todos los días. Este crédito es destinado para comprar sillas, bolsas, vasos, cucharas y cubiertos.  Espera seguir ampliando su negocio y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is 44 years old. She has a business selling plastic products. She feels very pleased to have the opportunity to access a loan. For more than 14 years she sold her products as a street vendor, but over time and with the help of her mother she managed to get her own establishment in the market. She gets up very early at 5 in the morning and works until 6 in the evening each day. This loan will be used to buy chairs, bags, cups, spoons and cutlery. She hopes to continue to expand her business and have higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy plastic products

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha es una mujer de 55 años de edad, comparte su vida con su esposo Daniel de 54 años y sus cuatro hijos en su casa propia. Ella se dedica desde hace varios años en la venta de ropa y calzados, siendo su método de trabajo por pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, es así que viaja frecuentemente al norte del país (ciudad que es conocida por su gran calidad en la fabricación de calzado) para adquirir éstos calzados a un menor precio, además compra ropa, que en su gran mayoría son del gusto del cliente. En un futuro quiere seguir mejorar su negocio para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá adquirir la cantidad de ropa y zapatos y con el pedido que tiene con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 55 year-old mother who shares her life with her husband Daniel, 54, and their 4 children in their own home. For a number of years she has sold clothing and footwear. She sells her products by taking orders from her customers. She travels frequently to the northern part of the country (to a city that is well-known for its high quality in shoe manufacturing) to acquire the shoes at a lower price. In addition she also buys clothing according to the tastes of her customers. In the future she wants to continue to improve her business so that she can increase her earnings. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she pledges to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she requests, she will be able to acquire a sufficient quantity of clothing and shoes to fill the orders she has from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more garments to fill orders from her customers

loans.name: Mirihan Liceht

texts.es:
MIRIHAN LICEHT A. M.,Trabaja Maestra B en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
 Va a utilizarlo en su mejora de su casa de habitación y algunos gastos personales.Toda la plata que va trabajar  con Ceprodel  la ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación, y solventar algunos gastos familiares.
 es madre soltera de un niño y este se encuentra en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Mirihan Liceht A. Martínez is working on her Master’s degree at the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua. She is going to use the loan to make improvements to her home and for some personal expenses. She has used her previous loans with Kiva partner CEPRODEL to improve her home and to settle some family expenses. She is a single mother who has one school-aged son.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making home improvements such as remodeling the floor of her home, and settling some personal expenses.

loans.name: Isabel Del Socorro

texts.es:
ISABEL DEL SOCORRO C. R., Trabajo como  Cocinera en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
Va a utilizarlo la plata en mejora de su vivienda va cambiar el sistema eléctrico de casa de habitación. Y repellar algunas paredes de su casa.
es madre soltera de dos niños y uno de ellos se encuentra en edad escolar.
dice que Toda la plata que va trabajar  con Ceprodel  la utilizar en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Isabel del Socorro C. R. works as a cook at the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua. She will use the money to improve her house; she will change the electrical system and plaster some of the walls of her house. She is a single mother of 2 children, one of whom is school-aged. She says that she will use all of the money from CEPRODEL to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will use the money to improve her house; she is going to change the electrical system and plaster some of the walls

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
WALTER ANTONIO R. D.,Trabaja como Vigilante en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua.El va a utilizar en la compra de materiales de construcción  de su casa va cambiar el Sistema Electrico de su casa, y el resto en gastos familiares.
es padre de familia de dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
dice; Toda la plata que ha trabajado  con Ceprodel  la ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación y algunos gastos familiares que tiene.
texts.en:
Walter Antonio R. D. works as a security guard in Managua's Ivan Montenegro market. He will use the loan to buy construction materials for his house. He will change the electrical system in his house, and will use the rest for personal expenses. He is the father of 2 children who are school-aged. He says that all of the money from CEPRODEL will be used to improve his house and pay for some household expenses that he has.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house: he will change the electrical system in his house and also pay for some household expenses.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
Milagro pertenece al Banco Comunal Milenio hace 4 años y lo que mas le agrada es la facilidad al préstamo y el incentivo al ahorro.
Milagro es conviviente, tiene 22 años y una hijas de 6 años, Milagro estudio cosmetología y trabaja en un salón de belleza, en donde también vende cosméticos por catalogo y también los exhibe en el salón, también brinda servicios a domicilio. Además Milagro junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con la cual trabaja su esposo.
Milagro necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de cosméticos y la reparación de su mototaxi.
Milagro sueña con tener una casa propia pues ahora vive en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Milagro has been a member of the Communal Bank “Milenio” (Millenium) for four years. What she enjoys most are the convenience of the loans and having the incentive to save.

Milagro is 22 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a six year old daughter. She is studying cosmetology and works at a beauty salon where she also sells cosmetics through a catalog. Milagro also displays her cosmetics at the salon and provides home services. Her husband has a motorcycle taxi that he uses for work.

Milagro needs a loan of 2000 PEN to buy cosmetics and pay for motorcycle taxi repairs. She dreams of having her own home since she currently lives with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & pay to repair her husband's motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera y vive en el sector Tejedores del distrito de Tambogrande, una distrito agrícola caracterizado por producir principalmente frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se gana la vida criando y vendiendo animales, ella suele críar ganado menor, específicamente ovejas, en un corral ubicado cerca a la vivienda donde vive, los suele alimentar con pastos naturales cuando sus animales han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre frecuentan la zona en donde vive.

Alejandrina desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales, de modo que estos se puedan desarrollar de mejor manera y puedan ser vendidos a mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Alejuandrina es una mujer responsable y bastante honesta, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar su calidad de vida, las personas que las conocen la consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 60 years old, single, and lives in the Tejedores sector of the District of Tambogrande. This farming district is known for producing fruits primarily for export and is situated in Piura Province, which is located in the region of Piura and more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Alejandrina makes her living by raising and selling animals, usually small livestock such as sheep. She has a corral next to her house where the animals feed on grasses until they reach the proper stage of development. The animals are sold to neighbors and to merchants who frequently visit the area.

Alejandrina wants to improve the diet of her animals so that they develop properly, thereby allowing her to sell them at a better price. In order to achieve this goal, she has decided to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN to purchase balanced animal feed.

Alejandrina is a responsible and honest woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can improve her quality of life. The people who know her consider her to be a peaceful and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es casada y tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando, Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio hace 15 años y durante este tiempo los prestamos le ayudaron a ampliar su negocio, recuerda con mucha nostalgia a Morenita dice que fue la única que confió en las mujeres cuando ninguna institución daba prestamos a mujeres como ella. Teodora tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días y hace algunos meses compro un carro para que alquilara diariamente.
Teodora solicita un crédito de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Teodora son terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casa para la comodidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teodora is married and has four children enrolled in school. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Milenio” (Millennium) for 15 years and used the loans she received during that time to expand her business. She remembers with great nostalgia the early days of FINCA when no other institution would grant loans to women like her. Teodora has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meats. She manages her business every day and bought a car a few months ago that she rents out on a daily basis.

Teodora is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. She dreams of finishing the construction of the second floor of her house so that her children will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es la esposa la señora Barbará Blanco.

El señor Eduardo R. esta terminando de un construir un cuarto en su vivienda para ofrecer a su familia mas comodidad. La casa que obtuvieron es de interés social por lo que son muy pequeñas las 2 recamaras, sus hijos ya están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio. Para poder realizar su proyecto el quiere comprar material de construcción.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the photograph is Sra. Barbará Blanco, the wife of the borrower.

Sr. Eduardo R. is finishing the construction of a room in his home to make his family more comfortable. His house, which he obtained through a government subsidy program, has two very small bedrooms. His children are growing and need their own space. In order to complete this project, he needs to buy construction materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to complete the construction of a room

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina pertenece al Banco Comunal Milenio hace 9 años y lo que mas le gusta es la facilidad del préstamo y las capacitaciones que la ayudan mucho en su negocio.
Justina es conviviente tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella, hace 1 año Justina vendía verduras en el mercado 12 de abril, era un trabajo forzado que dejo de realizar ahora tiene líneas telefónicas para lo cual tiene 6 personas que trabajan con las líneas, Justina esta por mas mañanas y por las noches. Además Justina realiza diferentes negocios dependiendo de la oportunidad. Justina esta construyendo el segundo piso de su casa.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ladrillos.
Justina sueña con comprar un carro moderno para alquilar y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Justina has been a member of the Communal Bank “Milenio” (Millennium) for nine years. What she likes most are the convenience of the loans and the training classes that have been a great help to her business.

Justina is in a common law marriage and has five children, three of whom still live with her. She began selling vegetables at the April 12th market a year ago after she was forced to leave her previous job. Justina also owns a call center and has six employees who manage the phone lines for her in the mornings and in the evenings. She pursues different businesses depending on the available opportunities.

Justina is currently adding a second floor to her house. She needs a loan of 900 soles to invest in the purchase of bricks. Justina dreams of purchasing a modern automobile that she can rent out and hopes to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bricks

loans.name: Azeneth

texts.es: Azeneth P. O. cuenta con su negocio de manualidades donde elabora trabajos decorativos para mesa, distintivos, plumas, separadores, plumas y mas; para todo tipo de evento según el modelo, color que le pidan. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde un año en el que ahora quiere comprar material para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes variedad de modelos y así estar preparada con material para cuando se le requiera de su servicio.
texts.en:
Azeneth P. O. has a craft business where she makes decorative table settings, badges, pens, dividers, and other items in different colors and styles for specific events. The work is performed based on orders she receives. Azeneth has been in business for a year and currently needs to buy materials so that she can continue offering her customers a variety of decorations. By having enough materials, she will be prepared whenever her services are needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase craft materials

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es conviviente y tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Karina viaja a las ferias de la región 3 veces por semana en donde compra cereales, animales, quesos, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, también elabora papa seca (papa sancochada, pelada, picada y secada al sol), además Karina trabaja en un restaurante como parrillera, actividad que realiza por las noches.
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio y solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Karina vive en la casa de sus suegros y sueña con construir su casa y comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Karina is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a son. She travels to the regional fairs three times a week to buy grain, animals, and cheeses. Karina then sells these products at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. She also prepares dried potatoes (which involves boiling, peeling, chopping, and drying the potatoes in the sun). In addition, Karina works at night at a restaurant where she is in charge of the grill.

Karina is a member of the Communal Bank “Milenio” (Millennium) and requests a loan for 1500 PEN in order to buy potatoes. She lives at the home of her in-laws and dreams of building her own house. Karina also hopes to buy a car that her husband can use for work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia N. F.  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 20 años. Actividad que le ayudado en su economía familiar ya que es el único ingreso que ella tiene para mantener a su familia pues es madre soltera. Julia quiere comprar mas ropa para seguir mostrando en su local variedad, lo que vende es usado pero de marcas muy conocidas y buena calidad. Julia desea un préstamo para surtir su negocio y así generar más ganancias.
texts.en:
Julia N. F. has been selling used clothing for 20 years. Since Julia is a single mother, this business has helped her household finances because it is the only source of income by which she is able to support her family. She wants to buy more clothing to display at her variety store. Even though the clothes she sells are used, they are from well-known brands and of good quality.

Julia needs a loan to restock her business so that she can generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
FRANCISCO JOSE R. R., Trabaja Colector  de Ruta en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua. el prestamo lo Va a utilizarlo en su mejora de su casa de habitación y algunos gastos personales.
es padre de familia de tres hijos dos se encuentran estudiando.
el dice que toda la plata que va trabajar  con Ceprodel  la ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación, y solventar algunos gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Francisco Jose R. R. is a toll collector at the Wholesale Market of Managua. This loan will be used to make improvements to his home and pay for some personal expenses. Francisco is the father of three children, two of whom are in school.

He says that all the money that he received by partnering with CEPRODEL has been used for home improvements and a few family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements & personal expenses

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo Méndez Castañeda y su esposa son una familia muy unida que se apoya mutuamente. El señor sale todas las mañanas a trabajar en un constructora como conductor. Su esposa tiene su negocio de la venta de frituras y dulces que ella mima empaqueta para venderlos a un buen precio a los niños quienes son los que más le compran. Para seguir teniendo más ingresos requieren un préstamo para comprar mas mercancía.
texts.en:
Arturo Méndez Castañeda and his wife are a close-knit family who supports one another. Every morning, Arturo leaves for his job at a construction site as a driver. His wife has a business selling fried foods and sweets. She packages these items and sells them at a good price to children who are most likely to buy them. To continue generating more income, Arturo needs a loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio y lo que mas le gusta son los prestamos fáciles que le ayudaron a ampliar su negocio y con los ingresos educar a sus hijos. Teodosia es casada y tiene 7 hijos, Teodosia viaja diariamente a las ferias de la región en donde compra quesos, animales menores, cereales, productos que comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Teodosia elabora papa seca (papa sancochada, pelada, picada y secada al sol), producto que es utilizada para la preparación de platos típicos.
Teodosia solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa y cereales.
Los sueños de Teodosia son construir su casa pues ahora vive en casa alquilada.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a member of the Milenio Communal Bank and what she likes the most are the easy loans that help her to grow her business and with the earnings educate her children. Teodosia is married and has 7 children, Teodosia travels daily to the fairs around the region where she buys cheese,small animals, cereals, products that she markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition Teodosia makes dried potatoes (parboiled, peeled and chopped potatoes dried in the sun), a product that is used in the preparation of typical dishes. Teodosia is asking for a loan of 1500 soles which will be invested in the purchase of potato and cereals. Teodosia dreams of building her home as at the moment she lives in a rented house.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of potato and cereals.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Alejandrina se dedica a la elaboración de papa seca (papa sancochada, pelada, picada y secada al sol), producto que es utilizada para la preparación de platos típicos. Sus ventas los realiza a intermediarios que llevan a la costa peruana.
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio y solicita un préstamo de 2500 soles para la compra de papa.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son comprar un carro para alquilar y comprar un terreno para construir otra casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is married and has 3 children. She makes a living preparing ‘papa seca’ [‘dried potatoes’: the potatoes are parboiled, peeled, chopped, and dried in the sun], a product that is used in preparing traditional Peruvian dishes. She sells her products to middlemen who transport them to the Peruvian coast. Alejandrina is a member of the Milenio Communal Bank. She is requesting a loan of 2500 soles so that she can purchase potatoes. Her dream is to purchase a car that she can rent out and to purchase land where she can build another house for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing potatoes.

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es:
Santos tiene 51 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Colera del distrito de Tambogrande, una distrito agrícola caracterizado por producir principalmente frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde ha sembrado mango y limón, actualmente el limón se encuentra en producción, las frutas que cosecha las ofrece en venta a las fábricas procesadoras de la zona, el depende de estas actividades para sostener la economía de su familia, por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para poder mantenerse en el negocio.

Santos desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas con los cuales pueda brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y asegurarse una buena cosecha, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es un padre de familia bastante trabajador y entregado a los suyos, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old, married, and lives with his 3 children in Colera, a district of Tambogrando which is an agricultural district known for producing primarily fruits for export. It is part of the Piura providence located within the region of the same name which is more than 3 hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He performs agricultural labor. He has some land where he has planted mangos and lemons, the lemons are currently in production. Harvested fruits are sold to area processing plants, activities that he depends on to maintain his household. He has always given the best of himself to uphold his business. Santos would like to purchase fertilizers and pesticides which will allow him to upkeep his crops and gurantee himself a good harvest. To achieve his objective he has requested for the first time, a loan of 1000 PEN ($375 USD) to Edpyme Alternativa. Santos is the father of a hard working family who are dedicated to helping their own. He longs to be able to offer his family a better quality of life. People who know him in the area where he lives have great respect and trust towards him.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and pesticides to upkeep his mango and lemon crops.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: María Lourdes O. trabaja arduamente para ver cumplido su sueño de tener un techo digno para ella y su familia y principalmente para su pequeño hijo. Ella está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc para mejorar el techo de su casa porque ha estado en malas condiciones pero está muy segura que gracias a sus esfuerzos, logrará llevar a cabo esta obra. Es por este motivo que espera que dicho crédito le sea otorgado y así suplirá las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Lourdes O. G. has one child of schooling age and she works as an educator at the Managua Oriental Market. The loan will be used for construction materials since she is planning on replacing the roof on her home due to water leaking inside the house during winter. She states that all the money requested from Ceprodel will be invested in the purchase of construction materials for her home, home improvements, miscellaneous expenses, and will be improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to replace a roof and plaster walls

loans.name: María Amelia

texts.es:
María Amelia es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector Santa Julia Ibedia del distrito de Tambogrande, una distrito agrícola caracterizado por producir principalmente frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, el negocio pone al alcance de la mano de sus vecinos y de las personas de caseríos aledaños diversos productos de consumo diario que les son de dificil acceso. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos económicos de la familia.

María desea adquirir mas mercadería para aumentar el stock de productos en su negocio y aumentar su nivel de ventas, por ello ha decidido solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan ampliar su negocio y poder responder de mejor modo a la demanda de sus clientes.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, siempre se esfuerza por mantener su negocio brindando a sus clientes productos de calidad y un trato amable. Su mayor enhelo es crecer como empresaria para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Amelia is a 40 year old housewife who lives with her husband and 2 children in the Santa Julia neighborhood in the district of Tambogrande, which is an agricultural district primarily characterized for producing fruit for export. The district is part of the Piura province located within the region of the same name which is more than 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells products of basic necessity and groceries in a small store located at her residence. The business puts diverse products of daily consumption at the hands of neighbors and people in surrounding villages that would otherwise have a hard time accessing them. With the gains she receives from her business activities she helps her husband, who works in agriculture, with household expenses. Maria wishes to purchase more merchandise to stock up on products for the business and increase her sales. That is why she has decided to request a loan for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 PEN ($375 USD) which will enable her to expand her business and better respond to her client's needs. She is a hard working woman, responsible, and always strives to maintain her business; offering her clients quality products and treating them kindly. She longs to grow as a business and be able to offer her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and basic necessity products.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Santa Julia Ibedia del distrito de Tambogrande, una distrito agrícola caracterizado por producir principalmente frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, el negocio pone al alcance de la mano de sus vecinos y de las personas de caseríos aledaños diversos productos de consumo diario que les son de dificil acceso. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad sostiene los gastos económicos de la familia, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales y eventualmente trabaja como peón agrícola.

Nestor desea adquirir mas mercadería para aumentar el stock de productos en su negocio y aumentar su nivel de ventas, por ello ha decidido solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le permitan ampliar su negocio y poder responder de mejor modo a la demanda de sus clientes.

Nestor es un padre entragado a su familia y bastante trabajador, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Nestor is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 3 children in the Santa Julia neighborhood in the district of Tambogrande; an agricultural district primarily characterized for producing fruits for export. The district belongs to the Piura province located within the region of the same name which is more than 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He sells groceries and products of basic necessity at a small store out of his residence. The business puts diverse products of daily consumption at the hands of neighbors and people from surrounding villages who otherwise would have difficulty accessing them. With his gains from the business he is able to provide for the household expenses. In addition, he is a farmhand and also raises and sells livestock. Nestor wishes to acquire more merchandise to stock the business with product and increase his level of sales. That is why he has decided to request his first loan to Edpyme Alternativa for 800 PEN ($300USD) which will enable him to expand his business and be able to better respond to his client's demands. Nestor is a father devoted to his family and very hard working, he longs to be able to offer his family a better quality of life. Neighbors and acquaintances in the area where he lives consider him to be a tranquil and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products of basic necessity and groceries to stock the business

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Hualtaco del distrito de Tambogrande, una distrito agrícola caracterizado por producir principalmente frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Al igual que la mayoria de  hombre de la zona se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde ha sembrado mango y limón, las frutas que cosecha las ofrece en venta a las fábricas procesadoras de la zona, el depende de estas actividades para sostener la economía de su familia, por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para poder mantenerse en el negocio.

Wilfredo desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas con los cuales pueda brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y asegurarse una buena cosecha, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

El es un padre de familia bastante trabajador y entregado a los suyos, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in the Hualtaco neighborhood in the district of Tambogrande; an agricultural district characterized for primarly producing fruit for export. Tambogrande belongs to the Piura province and is located within the region of the same name which is more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Just like the majority of men in the area, he works as a farmhand. He counts on a piece of farmland where he has planted mangos and lemons and the fruit he harvests, he sells to processing plants in the area. He depends on these business activities to maintain his household. He always gives his best in order to stay in the business. Wilfredo would like to purchase fertilizers and pesticides with which he can upkeep his crops and ensure himself a good harvest. In order to achieve his objective he has requested his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 500 PEN ($200USD). He is the head of household, hard working, and dedicated to care for his own. He longs to be able to offer his family a better quality of life. Those who know him in his neighborhood trust him and hold him in high regards.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and pesticide for upkeep of his mango and lemon crops

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa es soltera, tiene 25 años de edad y vive con sus padres en el distrito de Mórrope, un distrito caracterizado por estar conformado por un pueblo central y varios caseríos situados alrededor de la zona y que distan mucho entre sí, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y está ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene en su casa un pequeño negocio de venta de animales que ella misma cría (ovinos, porcinos y aves de corral), cuando sus animales han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos o negociantes que siempre frecuentan la zona. Este negocio le brinda los recursos necesarios para sostener a sus padres los acuales son de avanzada edad.

Su negocio ha ido prosperando y ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de ovejas, pero lo que percibe en ganancias no le basta para alimentarlas, por lo que está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1500 soles que invertirá en la compra de alimentos para sus animales.

Su deseo es que el negocio siga creciendo y hacer una pequeña granja que le brinde a ella y a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva y con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. Rosa está agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella en su anterior préstamo
texts.en:
Rosa is single, 25 years old, and lives with her parents in Mórrope, a district made up of a central village with various rural settlements spread out around it. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She runs a small business out of her house, selling animals that she raises herself (sheep, pigs, and caged birds). When her animals have reached a good level of development, she puts them up for sale to her neighbors or the merchants who frequent the area. This business provides her with the necessary income to take care of her aging parents. Her business has been prospering and she now has a good number of sheep, but her earnings are not enough to feed them. This is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of feed for her animals. She hopes that her business will continue to grow, and would like to start a small farm to offer her and her family a better quality of life. She has worked with Kiva and Edpyme Alternativa before and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making her repayments. Rosa is grateful to the people who helped her with her previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase well-balanced feed and to improve her business raising and selling animals
