loans.name: Burzu

texts.ru:
Burzu A. pereselenec iz Fuzuli, i seychas on projivayet v Fuzuli regione ,< Behmenli village>. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey , sinu 14 let on uchitsya v shkole, dochke 18 let ona uchitsya v universitete i sinu 19 let  on toje uchitsya v universitete i takje xodit na muziku. 

Eto vtoroy ssud Burzu , v perviy raz on bral dengi chto bi kupit  dlya svoyeqo kafe . on ochen blaqodaren Kive za ssudu.

Burzu 2 qoda tomu nazad reshil zanatya jivotnavodstvom. I teper on nujdayetsya  v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit novix < calves>. On pokupayet malenkix  potom virostiv ix  on prodayet ix maso.
texts.en:
Burzu A. is a refugee from Fuzuli who currently lives in Behmenli village in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has three children. His fourteen-year-old son goes to school. His daughter is eighteen and studies at the university. His nineteen-year-old son also studies at the university as well as studying music. This is Burzu’s second loan. The first time, he took money to buy supplies for his café. He is very thankful to Kiva for the loan. Two years ago, Burzu decided to work in animal husbandry. Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy new calves. He buys them small, then raises them and sells their meat.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola N. is 19 years-old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Viola has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Viola has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Viola hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food and clothes for her children.  In the future, Viola hopes to enlarge her business

Note to lenders:   BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. Initially, the ELA program provides disadvantaged adolescents, particularly girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future.  The program targets a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans and to give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Damalie

texts.en:
Damalie K. is 21 years-old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Damalie has had a business raising poultry for the last five years.  

To help expand her business, Damalie has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase and buy more chickens.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Damalie hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes to buy milk for her children.  In the future, Damalie hopes to own land for her business.              

Note to lenders:   BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. Initially, the ELA program provides disadvantaged adolescents, particularly girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future.  The program targets a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans and to give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more chicken.

loans.name: Adiyo

texts.en: Adiyo A. is in the business of selling peeled dried cassava tubers and sorghum at the market and is requesting a loan to also stock bags of maize and millet to sell.  Adiyo is 29 years-old and is married with a husband who is a cattle keeper. She has two children and they go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and millet to sell.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en: Poni J.  is in the business of selling food in a restaurant at Gumbo market and is requesting a loan to stock more food for the restaurant.  Poni is 38 years-old and is married with a husband that is a peasant.  She has three children who go to school.  With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock food.

loans.name: Khanim

texts.ru:
Khanim A. 56 let. Ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli, I seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione , . Ona ne zamujem i jivet odna. 

Khanim A. uje 5 let zanimayesya etim biznesom prodaji sira , moloka, zeleni i razniz ovoshey i fruktov. Khanim seychas nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji. Ranshe Khanim sama imela korov i iz ix moloka delala sir i prodovala no uje ona ne uspevayet i poeotmu ona reshila otkrit maqazin i zanimatsya uje etim delom.
texts.en:
Khanim A. is 56 years old. She is a refugee from Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region. She is unmarried and lives alone. For five years, Khanim A. has been selling cheese, milk, greens, vegetables, and fruit. Khanim now needs 2000 AZN to buy produce for resale. Earlier, Khanim had her own cow, and from its milk she made cheese and sold it. However, she no longer has time for that, and therefore she decided to open a store and work there.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying produce

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from operating tricycle transport services. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Nelia joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Nelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.name: Tanriverdi

texts.ru:
Tanriverdi M. 43 let. On jenat  imeyet 3 detey  dochka 12 let kotoraya zaniamyetsya tancami i uchitsya v shkole, sin 15 let kotoriy uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom, i dochka 18 let kotoraya postupila v etom qodu v universitet. Tanriverdi i eqo semya yavlyayusta  oni  pereselenci in Fuzuli, Seychas projivayut v Fuzuli regione.

Tanriverdi uje 7 let zanimayetsya skotorvodstvom. On delayet sir i yoqurt iz moloka i prodayet na rinok. Teper on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit < calves> i uvelichit kolichestvo produkta dlya prodaji.
texts.en:
Tanriverdi M. is 43 years old. He is married and has three children. His twelve-year-old daughter goes to school and studies dance. His son is fifteen, studies in school, and plays sports. His eighteen-year-old daughter entered the university this year. Tanriverdi and his family are refugees from Fuzuli and now live in the Fuzuli region. Tanriverdi has been a herdsman for seven years. He makes cheese and yogurt from milk and sells them at the market. Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy calves and increase the amount of product available to sell.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina A. is currently in the business of brewing and selling alcohol at home. She is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell.  

Sabina is 45 years old and widowed. She has eight children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock food items for her family and send two of her young children to school.

loans.use: Stock crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose G. is currently in the business of selling sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and beans. She is requesting a loan to stock maize flour and pulses (ground nuts, peas and cowpeas) to sell.  

Rose is 47 years old and married to a teacher. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock maize flour and pulses to sell

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en:
Teyyub M. has been engaged in the farming business for more than 15 years. He breeds calves in the small village of Imishli. He sells cattle to the local butchers and cafes. His monthly income is about 250-300 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN).

Teyyub needs a loan of 900 AZN to buy more cattle and increase the number of animals he has. Teyyub has four children and he hopes to improve their life conditions.

loans.use: Purchase three calves

loans.name: Mammad

texts.en:
Mammad M. is a 47-year-old man who owns a small farm. He is married with three children. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example.

Mammad runs a business raising and selling cattle and has 20 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, he has become a very successful businessman in a very short period of time. He works very hard and spends all his time with the animals, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them.

Now, Mammad wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, so he applied for a loan of 1000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN).

loans.use: Purchase one cow and a calf

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is single and has three children, all of whom are currently schooling. Annet has a retail shop, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stock in her retail shop.  

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and to educate her children. In the future, Annet hopes to own a big retail shop.

loans.use: To increase the stock in her retail shop

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin Q. is 33 years old and married. He has sold food products for the last three years and this is the only income for his family. The plans that he has for his family are to improve their living conditions. His monthly income is about 250-400 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN). 

He wants to increase the sales of new products preferred by his clients. He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to buy products such as bread, tinned goods, sweets and juices to grow his revenue.

loans.use: Purchase more food products

loans.name: Madine

texts.en:
Madine S. is a devoted mother of 2 children who has bred cattle since her youth. She took advantage of the space she had available on her family’s land to start this business, which she runs together with her husband. Her clients are butchers and café owners.

Slowly her number of cows has increased and her clients have started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps, and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Agamammad

texts.en:
Agamammad M. is 54 years old and is married with five children. He dedicated himself to his livestock business in 2000. When he recognized the need to invest in his work, Agamammad decided to increase his income and for this he requires more animals, so he is planning to buy more sheep.

His monthly profit is about 300 AZN and he believes with this loan he could increase it to 500 AZN. He applied for 1,500 AZN so he can purchase both lambs and cattle.

loans.use: purchase 10 sheep and one calve

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil A. is a young guy who likes to make his own way. He has run a clothing business for more than 2 years, which is how Jamil supports his family. Little by little and with hard work, his business has expanded. Still, Jamil wants his business to grow even more.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN which he will spend to buy more merchandise. This way he will have new products to offer to his customers. He already has one loan from AqroInvest which was successfully completed and Jamil is recommended as a trustworthy client.

loans.use: purchase more inventory for the store

loans.name: Oqtay

texts.en:
Oqtay A. is a successful father and dedicated husband. He is married and has two children. Oqtay began a small grocery store years ago with his savings. He was assisted by his wife, who helps him to serve his clients. 

Today, his clientele has grown greater and his grocery store has become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Oqtay applied for a 1,500 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) loan to purchase more food products to increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase more food products

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn C. is from the town of Sinamar Sur San Mateo. She is 37 years old. Noralyn is married and has four school-aged children. Noralyn owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Noralyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Noralyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Noralyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Noralyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Namiq

texts.en: Namiq M., a married father of two children, has been selling groceries for the past three years in a store located in a very busy place, one of the reasons he always has many customers.  A hard worker who labours long days to make sure his family has everything they need,  his monthly income is about 330-400 AZN.   Namiq` s business is the only source of income for his family, so he takes this responsibility seriously and is doing his best to meet the needs of his children. Today he is requesting a loan of 900 AZN to purchase more food items.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for his grocery store

loans.name: Qabil

texts.en: Qabil A. is 45 years old. He has two years of experience in the butcher business. His wife is a housekeeper, and Qabil is the sole breadwinner in his family. Due to this way of life, this father of three children works hard every day to support his family with the best quality of life he can afford. His butcher shop supplies large amounts of meat to the people who reside in the area. Qabil buys cattle at the market and sells fresh meat daily to his customers. Due to high demand, this man seeks a loan of 500 Azerbaijani manat (AZN) to invest in more cattle so he can have enough meat to meet his customers’ demand.

loans.use: buying more cattle to butcher

loans.name: Agamekhti

texts.en:
Agamekhti A. is 53 years old, married, and has two children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs, like candies, cookies, preserved foods, soft drinks, juice, tea, fresh fruits and many other items in the grocery store he built many years ago. 

Today, Agamekhti is requesting a loan of 1,000 Azerbaijani manat (AZN) to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his goals is to open more stores. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more food products to increase his income

loans.name: Nijat

texts.en:
Nijat A. is 22 years old and is not married. Due to his family’s financial situation, he did not have many opportunities to study at the university. That’s why, after finishing school, he tried to become independent and to find a way of earning money in order to help his parents with the family’s expenses.

Since 2008, Nijat has supported his family through his efforts and started his business selling cell phones. His monthly income is about 300-350 Azerbaijani manat (AZN). He believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family.

Currently, his business is doing well, but Nijat needs to increase his stock of goods in order to serve the demands of his clientele. With this purpose in mind, Nijat requests 1000 AZN. He is grateful to all those supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: purchase more cell phones

loans.name: Ilyas

texts.en:
Ilyas N. is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. For the last four years Ilyas has been working as a market vendor. He sells food products which are always in demand among the population. His monthly income is about 500 Azerbaijani manat (AZN).

The love for his child is the biggest reason for Ilyas to make an effort to provide what his family needs. Ilyas is planning to enlarge the range of his goods and is requesting 1000 AZN to do so.

loans.use: purchase more products to increase profit

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya H. is 51 years old and comes from a large but humble family. She is married and the loving mother of two children. She is a nurse in local hospital but her salary is too small and she needed additional financial support. In 2004 she started a poultry breeding business and now it is her main source of income. 

Now Raya dedicates herself to raising poultry and cattle, and with the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children. Her monthly profit is about 150-200 Azerbaijani manat (AZN) and she would like to increase it. Her permanent clients demand is meat and she is going to purchase more cattle and chicken. 

Raya is asking for a 900 AZN loan in order to buy more young cattle and poultry to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase calves and poultry

loans.name: Makhbuba

texts.en: Makhbuba R. is a hard working mother. She works as a teacher in a local school, but earns a very low salary. Hard life conditions pushed her to start her own business in 2007. She started breeding cattle and selling it to the local butchers. She has become an experienced farmer and has had successful business growth. This business is the main source of income for her family. Her monthly income is about 250-300 AZN. She works very hard to support her three children. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar H. has always distinguished himself as a very hard working person, devoted to his family, who are his role models. Ilqar has managed his own business, a grocery store, for the last 10 years.

Thanks to his business, Ilqar has been able to help his family. Today, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 900 AZN. He needs you, and through your generosity you can help him expand his business so that he may continue to support his three children.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.en:
Ulviyya A. is 20 years old. She is married with one baby. Ulviyya sells women's clothes. She has been in this business almost a year. Ulviyya has very good taste, and she is always ready to advise her customers on which clothes to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has her constant customers. Moreover, Ulviyya’s prices are attractive for various levels of the population, as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and wallet. Her monthly profit is 200-300 AZN.
 
She hopes that she can continue developing her business. Now, Ulviyya needs 600 AZN to purchase new clothes in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes

loans.name: Farahim

texts.en: Farahim M. is 53 and married with two children. Today, as head of his household, he works tirelessly to generate a stable income. He works caring for his animals, getting up very early to gather grasses so he can keep his livestock well fed. Farahim sells the milk they produce to the community. He is seeking this current loan in order to purchase one additional cow and fodder for expanding his business. He successfully completed his first loan from AqroInvest and purchased two cattle. He has applied for 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en: Khanlar H. is 50 years old. He is married and has two children. Khanlar is the sole breadwinner for his family, and his only income comes from farming crops. Every year, he buys new sorts of seeds for seasonal fruits and vegetables. He is not alone in his business; his wife helps him. With his first loan from AqroInvest Khanlar was able to expand his business. Today, Khanlar is thinking about further expanding his business, since the income from his present crops isn't enough to provide for his family. He wishes to buy more seeds for this season. To do this, he needs to invest an additional 1,000 AZN in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more seed to increase his crops

loans.name: Together Women Group

texts.en: Regina B., holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Together Women."  Regina is 36 years old, single and has five children who range from 6 to 19 years old. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to lack of financial support. For 16 years, she has sold doughnuts in Omega Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 38,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, egg, milk etc. She describes herself as an earnest woman whose dream it is to grow her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Marieter D. is inset because she was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, sugar, egg, milk etc.

loans.name: Unity Five Group

texts.en: Oretha T., holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Unity Five." Oretha is 39 years old, married and has three children between 8 and 15. She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to lack of financial support. For 15 years, she has sold dishes (bowls) in Redlight Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 50,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more dishes (bowls) to sell. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman. Her dream is to expand her business and build a house. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Naomi K. is inset because she was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more dishes (bowls).

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac M. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Ntugamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children — all of them in school. Isaac has a business of mixed farming and timber cutting, which he has had for 8 years. To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more trees to plant for timber and manure and fertilizers for the banana plantation.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Isaac hopes to generate greater profits and educate his children up to university. In the future, Isaac hopes to become a successful business man.

loans.use: to buy more trees for to plant for timber and manure

loans.name: Fuligyensia

texts.en: Fuligyensia K. is 50 years old and lives in the town of Ntugamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.  Fuligyensia has a business of mixed farming and sugar cane, which she has had for over 10 years. To help expand her business, Fuligyensia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizer for the bananas. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fuligyensia hopes to generate greater profits, expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for the bananas

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a dedicated and hard-working farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. She has been operating her mixed farm for over 30 years. Her farm produces milk, maize, and beans which she sells locally. She depends on the income from her farm to fulfill the basic needs of her family. Rosemary is 52 years old and married. She has seven children between the ages of 13 and 29 five of whom are still in school. She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 41,600 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to take care of her family's basic needs. She however faces the challenge of fluctuation in market prices and changes in climate conditions that affect the cost of poultry feed. She hopes to increase her milk productivity and enjoy more income. She is grateful to Juhudi for empowering her economically.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years in the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. His farm produces maize, beans, vegetables and milk, which he sells locally. He also runs a cereals business.

Samwel is 28 years old. He is married and has been blessed with three children who are between the ages of 20 months and 6 years. Two of his children attend school.

Samwel has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 36,400 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with the income from this loan, his children will be able to access a good education and have good health. His primary challenge has been the changing weather patterns, which affect his production, and also theft in the area.

In the future, he hopes that he will be able to expand his 2-acre farm to 6 acres and keep four dairy animals with a poultry farm. He appreciates the loan from Juhudi and hopes it will be of great help.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 48 years old, married and has been blessed with three children, who are now between the ages of 14 and 23. All the children attend school. She has been farming for the past 12 years and has employed one farmhand. Her farm produces maize, bananas, beans and milk, which she sells locally. She also earns income from the sale of cereals and plastics. She also owns some rental houses in the same area.

Gladys has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 41,600 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the proceeds from the sale of milk will enable her to educate her children and they will have enough milk for consumption.

She hopes that in the next five years, she will be able to have five quality dairy cows to enable her produce 100 liters of milk daily. She hopes Juhudi will continue supporting them.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Wanjohi

texts.en:
Wanjohi is a farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. He has been farming for 18 years. His farm produces vegetables, milk, maize, beans, potatoes and eggs, which he sells to the local market. Wanjohi is happy about his farming activities since he solely depends on the income from farming to cater for the needs of his family.

Wanjohi recently completed his fifth loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand his poultry project. He says that the extra income he will earn will enable him to invest in other income-generating activities to supplement his income. He does, however, face the challenge of poultry diseases and a poor market for his products.

Wanjohi is 37 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 9. Two of the children attend school. In the future, he hopes not only to keep the local breed of birds but to also keep the exotic breed.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a 50-year-old married father of five children, all attending school, has been farming for the last 10 years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces bananas and milk which he sells to the local market. He also operates a general shop in the same area.

John's biggest challenges in farming have been competition leading to lower prices and getting a high quality breed of dairy animal. However, in the future he hopes to have five quality dairy cows which will earn him a daily income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings and enable him to service a loan of more than one million Kenyan Shillings.

John has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand his poultry project. He says that the extra income from this loan will enable him pay school fees for his children. He hopes that with the decrease in lending rates by the Central Bank, Juhudi will look at their interest rate.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been operating her mixed farm for the last three years in the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. Her main products are maize, millet, beans, and milk, which she sells to schools in the area. She also earns income from her rental houses.

Hellen is 46 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 6 children aged 10 to 22. All the children attend school.

Hellen has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand her poultry project and build a dairy unit. She says that the extra income from this project will enable her to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to have a big poultry farm and be able to supply eggs and chickens to other farmers in her group.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project and build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a hardworking farmer from the town of Kitale, Western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and sells his maize, beans, vegetables, milk, and bananas to the local market. He also earns income from his hotel and butchery which he operates in the same area. He also keeps poultry so he earns income from the sale of eggs.

Moses has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 62,400 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help in paying school fees for his children and their health will improve since they will have enough milk for consumption.

Moses is 34 years old. He is married and has been blessed with four children between the ages of 2 and 13. Three of the children are currently attending school. In the future, he would like to own a pick-up truck to assist in the transportation of milk.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ana Yolima

texts.es:
Ana Oliveri es una joven  casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 8 y 10 años,  que se mueve responsablemente frente a entre las funciones que genera ser madre y esposa y su compromiso personal de generar ingresos a partir de su negocio como comerciante y manicurista. 
En el año 2002 llegó a Barranquilla procedente del Banco en el departamento del Magdalena. , inició su negocio cuando después de hacer un curso de belleza y ya trabajando como manicurista en práctica, aumentaron sus gastos y un cliente le recomendó vender por medio de guías especializadas, fuè así como, desde ese momento en que lo decidió, empezó a conseguir clientes y no ha parado de hacerlo porque le ha ido muy bien.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su primer financiamiento, notó que obtuvo más ganancias y que en las temporadas  de mayor  repunte de las ventas, debía buscar financiamiento como lo está haciendo en este momento con su credikiva, que adquiriéndolo, le ayuda a  prepararse para la segunda temporada del año, época en que hay mayor movilización de mercancías pues ya se aproxima las fiestas  de fin de año con primas y bonificaciones y sus clientes aprovechan para comprar los productos que justamente Ana vende. Por eso su credikiva lo invertirá en productos de maquillaje y perfumería, crema y accesorios, blusas, pantalones  e insumos como esmaltes y uñas postizas  para su negocio como manicurista.
Ana Yolima se prepara para esta temporada de mucho trabajo y seguramente lo hará de manera  persistentemente, porque quiere cumplir sus sueños de tener un punto de venta en una miscelánea y lograr adquirir su vivienda propia, que es su gran anhelo.
texts.en:
Ana Oliveri is a young married woman who has 2 children, aged 8 and 10 years old. She moves responsibly through her duties as mother and wife, as well as her personal commitment to create income through her business as a saleswoman and manicurist. In 2002, she came to Baranquilla from Banco, in the department of Magdalena. She started her business when, after taking a beauty course and already working as a manicurist, her expenses went up. A customer suggested that she go into catalog sales. From the moment that she decided to do so, she started gaining customers and she has not stopped since because it's gone very well. This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With her first loan, she noted that her income increased and she decided that she should seek financing in the seasons of higher sales, which she is is doing right now with her "credikiva," or Kiva loan. Getting this loan will help her to prepare for the second part of the year, a period when she moves more merchandise as the end-of-year holidays approach and people receive premiums and bonuses. Her customers take advantage of this to buy the products that only Ana sells. She will invest this "credikiva" in makeup and perfume products, creams and accessories, blouses, pants, and supplies for her manicure business, such as polishes and artificial fingernails. Ana Yolima will prepare for this busy period and she will most surely do so with persistence, because she wants to achieve her dream of having a sales counter in a general store, and her greatest dream is to acquire her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy makeup and perfume products, creams and accessories, blouses, pants, and supplies for her manicure business, such as polishes and artificial fingernails

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abdulio

texts.es:
Abdulio tiene 45 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazan, esta acompañado y vive con la esposa y la hija de 4 años de edad, ellos actualmente alquilan la casa donde residen, el tiene un taller de estructuras metalicas.
Tiene 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el frabrica balcones metalicos, puertas y otros, la zona de trabajo es el Departamento de Morazan el horario que regularmente atiende el taller es de 6:00am - 3:00pm.El se avisto en la neceisdad de solicitando un prestamo para compra de materiales como son soldares, hierro para fabricar puertas.
Las aspiraciones son que el taller sea amplio y le permita genrar mejores ingresos para mejora las condiciones d evida d ela familia.
texts.en:
Abdulino is 45 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera, located within the Morazan department, along with his wife and four year old daughter in a rented home. He has a metal shop where he’s been in the business of making metal balconies, doors, and other things. He works within the Morazan zone, normally from 6:00 AM to 3:00 PM. [Abdulio] has seen the need to request a loan so that he can buy welding supplies and iron in order to make doors. He hopes to be able to expand his shop so that he can bring in better income and improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for over five years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk, vegetables, and mangoes, which he sells locally. He is excited about his farming activities since he has been able to provide for the needs of his family with the income.

Fred is 35 years old. He is married and has been blessed with five children between the age of 18 months and 9 years. Four of the children are currently attending school.

Fred has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to expand his poultry project. He says that this loan will help his family as they will get additional income and his children will be able to go to school. However, he faces the challenge of lack of enough animal feed during the dry seasons.

Fred is happy with the help he has been given and promises to pay the loan well and get more loans for development.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years in Kisii, Western Kenya. Her farm produces sugarcane, bananas, maize, beans, and milk, which she sells to the local market. She is happy with her farming activities since she has been able to provide for the basic needs of her family with the income.

Rebecca recently completed her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings and has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow. She says that if the returns from this loan are good, then she will be able to educate her children and build rental houses.

Rebecca is 51 years old and married, with six children between the ages of 17 and 25. Two of her children attend school.

Rebecca would like to increase the scale of her sugarcane farming. She however faces the challenge of lack of capital for expansion and poor prices.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Berta reside en barrio el centro Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposo y una hija de la edad de 26 años la cual le ayuda a trabajar en el negocio de venta de carne.
Tiene 20 años de trabajar en la venta de carne el horario es de 7 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde, y una de las dificultades es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para la inversión en el negocio.
Esto lo invertirá en la compra de  mercadería como carne pollos, esto le ayudara a contar con los productos necesarios para satisfacer la demanda del cliente y le beneficiara ya que obtendrá mejores ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones son ampliar más su negocio y así poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Berta lives in the central Corinto neighborhood of the Morazán department, along with her husband and 26 year old daughter who helps her in her butcher business. She’s been selling meats for 20 years and works from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM. One of her challenges is that she doesn’t have the money to invest into the business. She will invest the money from this loan in merchandise, such as chickens. This will help her to have the products on hand that she needs to satisfy her customer demands and will help her increase her income. She aspires to expand her business so that she can improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
For the last 12 years, Andrew has been operating and managing his mixed farm in Kisii, a town in western Kenya. His farm produces maize, beans, bananas, sugarcane, and milk, which he sells to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to provide for the needs of his family.

Andrew is 40 years old. He is married with two children, ages 4 and 5. Both children attend school.

He has requested this loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes to earn enough profit to enable him to build permanent business premises. He also hopes to open a big retail shop specializing in farm produce at his location.

He appreciates how far Juhudi Kilimo has brought him, and he has hopes that he will grow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Eugenio Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Eugenio Ramón O. S. es Joyero, posee un tramo en el sector del bisne,  realiza trabajos como anillos, chapas, cadenas de oro y de platas, según cual prefiera el cliente, es casado, tiene 4 hijos pero solo uno depende de él, los demás son independientes y uno de ellos se dedica también a la joyería.

El Señor Eugenio Ramón O. S., tiene 50 años de dedicarse al trabajo de joyería, lleva ya 42 créditos con CEPRODEL, y siempre ha pagado muy puntual sus créditos.
texts.en:
Eugenio Ramón O. S. is a jewler who has a shop in the Bisne sector. He works with rings, metal, gold and silver chains, whichever the customer prefers. He is married and has four children, but only one who is still dependent on him. The others are on their own now. One of his other sons is also a jeweler. Eugenio has been doing this for 50 years. He has had 42 previous loans through CEPRODEL and has always made his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies; gold and silver

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past 20 years and has employed three people from his community. His farm produces maize, beans, vegetables and tomatoes, which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from his carpentry and engineering business in the same area.

Dominic has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand his poultry project. He says that the income from this loan will enable him to cater for the needs of his family. He does, however, face the challenge of diseases and theft of animals.

Dominic is 54 years old. He is married and has been blessed with seven children, who are now between the ages of 2 and 22. Four of the children are currently attending school. In the future, he plans to acquire four more dairy cows and 300 chickens.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farming

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is an active member and treasurer of the Bubayi Group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She has been practicing mixed farming for 14 years and has employed one farmhand. She sells her milk and millet to the local market. She is also in the business of buying and selling cows.

Rosemary is 39 years old. She is married and has been blessed with three children who are now between the ages of 6 and 20. All the children attend school.

Rosemary has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will help her buy a good dairy cow that will produce enough milk for consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will enable her to take her children to school.

In five years time, she plans to have five dairy cows and be the main milk supplier to the local market and Kenya Cooperative Creameries.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Félix Jerónimo

texts.es:
El señor Felix Jerónimo M. R. se dedica a reparación de bicicletas y es propietario de dos triciclos, habita en el bario Camilo Ortega, es casado, tiene solo un hijo y ya es independiente, es mayor de edad.

Lleva ya 21 créditos con CEPRODEL los cuales los ha pagado en tiempo y forma, actualmente solicito créditos para realizar unas reparaciones en su casa ya que el techo está un poco deteriorado y se le pasa el agua, los creditos anteriores los ha utilizado para reparacion de sus medios de trabajo.
texts.en:
Felix Jerónimo M. R. repairs bicycles and owns two tricycles. He lives in the Camilio Ortega neighborhood, is married and has one adult son who is now on his own. He has had 21 previous loans through CEPRODEL, which he has repaid as agreed. He is asking for this loan in order to be able to make repairs to the roof of his house, as the roof is a bit deteriorated and it leaks. He used the previous loans to make repairs to his work media.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina tiene 31 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, es casada vive con el esposo y cinco hijos, Glenda D. 11 años, Alexander D. 9, Lisseth 7, Leydi 5 y Yancy D. 2 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración D. Tamales ( masa D. maíz con pollo).
La señora venD. tamales hace 8 meses, los comercializa D. forma ambulante por la zona D. San Francisco Gotera, Actualmente solicita un préstamo para compra D. materiales para la producción D. tamales, ella compraría Maíz, Especies, Hojas D. Banano, Pollo, y otros productos necesario para la elaboración D. tamales, este dinero le ayudara para continuar con el negocio, aumentar las ventas para mejorar los ingresos.
Las aspiraciones D. Rosalina son apoyar a los hijos con los estudios D. bachillerato, mejorar la calidad D. vida D. la familia.
texts.en:
Rosalia is 31 years old and lives in the town of San Francisco Gotera, within the Morazán department. She is married and lives with her husband and five children; Glenda, age 11; Alexander, age 9; Lisseth, age 7; Leydi, age 5; and Yancy, age 2. She makes tamales (cornmeal dough stuffed with chicken), and has been selling them around the San Francisco Gotera zone on foot for the past eight months. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy supplies and ingredients, such as dried corn, spices, banana leaves, chicken, and other items that she needs to make tamales. This money will help her to continue her business and allow her to increase her sales and income. Rosalia’s aspirations are to support her children with their baccalaureate studies and to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Ivet María

texts.es:
Doña Ivet María R. D., es soltera tiene dos hijos es de profesión contador público habita junto a su familia en el barrio Guadalupe, desde hace treinta y ocho años,  trabaja en alcaldía Chinandega desempeñándose como secretaria desde hace 21 años,
Doña Ivet María R. D., tiene nueve años de trabajar con créditos en CEPRODEL, de los cuales ha adquirido seis créditos cancelando cinco créditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad, doña Ivet dice sentirse agradecida con el apoyo que le hemos brindado de darle los créditos en el momento preciso  por que ha podido reparar poco a poco su vivienda y resolver problemas de índole personal .
texts.en:
Ivet María R. D. is single and has two children. She is an accountant by profession and lives in the Guadalupe neighborhood, along with her family. She’s been working for the Chinandera city hall for a total of 38 years and has spent the past 21 years working as a secretary. Ivet has been working with CEPRODEL loans for the past nine years and has received six prior loans, five of which she has repaid responsibly. Ivet is grateful for the support we have given her with these loans at the time she needed them to repair her house little by little and solve some insolvency problems.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Lester Modesto

texts.es:
El señor Lester Modesto M. R., es Comerciante se dedica a Venta de Muebles en el sector de el Bisne, ofrece a su clientela Roperos de 2 y 3 cuerpos, Juegos de sillas abuelitas, Comedor, Mesas, Camas de junco, Mil uso,  es casado no tienen hijos y el atiende personalmente su negocio, habita en el barrio  San Agustín, parte de su mercadería se la traen hasta acá y otra parte tiene que viajar a Managua a traerla.

El señor Lester M. lleva 3 créditos con ceprodel los cuales los han utilizado para ir aumentando su inventario y siempre ha pagado en tiempo y forma sus créditos, es muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Lester Modesto M. R. is a merchant who sells furniture in the Bisne sector. He sells two or three tier wardrobes (armoires); rocking chairs, dinette sets, tables, reed beds, etc. He is married and doesn’t have any children. He personally attends to his business and lives in the San Agustín neighborhood. Some of his merchandise is delivered to him and some he has to pick up in Managua. Lester has had three prior loans through CEPRODEL, which he has used to increase his inventory. He has always made his payments on time and he has been very responsible with his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La joven María Elena L. M., es casada tiene un hijos menor de edad vive junto a su familia en el municipio el viejo, iglesia esquípala 80vras abajo, es una joven profesional con deseos de superación y desarrollarse en el campo laboral, actualmente trabaja para la Alcaldía municipal de Chinandega laborando como asistente de finanza desde hace más de nueve años
 La joven María Elena L. M. ha obtenido cinco créditos de los cuales ha cancelado cuatro, dice sentirse agradecida por la confianza que le hemos brindado ya que con estos créditos a mejorado su vivienda y le han ayudado a resolver algunos problemas de índole familiares.
texts.en:
María Elena L. M. is married and has one young son. She and her family live in “Iglesia Esquípala” part of the town of El Viejo. She is a young professional with a desire to succeed in the workforce and has been working as a finance assistant for the Chinandega city hall for more than nine years. This young lady has had five previous loans and has repaid four of them. She tells us that she is grateful for the trust that we have placed in her, especially because these loans have helped to improve her home and have helped her to resolve some family insolvency issues.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Ramón Sabas

texts.es:
Don Ramón Sabas V. E., es soltero tiene dos hijos menores de edad vive junto a su familia en el barrio la florida desde hace cinco años, es de profesión contador público trabaja en la alcaldía municipal de Chinandega desde hace seis años como auditor fiscal dice sentirse realizado en su familia y en su trabajo como profesional ya que es útil para el desarrollo de su municipio.
Don Ramón Sabas V. E. es cliente activo de CEPRODEL desde hace más de cuatro años con tres créditos cancelados y uno activo estos créditos los ha utilizado para mejoras de vivienda y resolver problemas familiares, dice sentirse agradecido ya que son créditos accesibles y con tasas de interés bajas.
texts.en:
Ramón Sabas V. E. is single and has two young children. He and his family have lived in the “La Florida” neighborhood for five years. He is an accountant and has been working as an auditor for the Chinandega city hall for the past six years. He tells us that he feels established with his family and his professional career, because it is helpful to the development of the city. Ramon has been actively working with CEPRODEL for more than four years and has had three prior loans, which he has used to make improvements to his home and to resolve some family issues. He tells us that he is grateful because these loans are within reach and the interest rates are low.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicine

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Manuela del Socorro M. es madre soltero habita en el barrio Camilo Ortega desde hace treinta años con su hijo menor, es una señora emprendedor muy trabajadora y con deseos de superación, actualmente tiene su negocio de venta de comida en el mercado Bisne sector comida, los fines de semana tiene se dedica a su otro negocio de comida ubicado en las playas de paso caballo Corinto  
Doña Manuela M. es clienta activa con más de cuatro años de trabajar con créditos en CEPRODEL de los cuales ha cancelado treinta y dos créditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad cabe señalar que todos estos créditos son revolvente cada dos meses permitido  mantener mi negocio estable e irme ampliando y mejorando las condiciones
texts.en:
Manuela del Socorro M. is a single mother who has lived in the Camilo Ortega neighborhood for the past 30 years. She has one young son and is a very hard working and entrepreneurial woman with a desire to get ahead. She sells prepared food in the Bisne market’s food section. On the weekends she runs her other food business, located on the Paso Caballo Corinto beach. Manuela M. has been an active client, working with CEPRODEL for more than four years, during which time she has had two prior loans and has demonstrated responsibility in their repayment. These are revolving loans that turn over every month, allowing her business to remain stable and allowing her to expand and improve its conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen reside en cantón Gualindo arriba lolotiquillo departamento de Morazán, tiene 44 años de edad vive con su esposa y tres hijos entre las edades de 2 a 6 años los cuales dependen de los ingresos que Carmen obtiene de su negocio.
Se dedica hace 4 años a la compra y venta de ganado y a la vez el los destaza dos veces a la semana y  vende la carne con los vecinos de la zona, aprendió este oficio gracias a que su padre también se dedicaba a lo mismo y le enseño.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas ganado para el destazo y también comprara fertilizante para la siembra de granos.
El crédito le ayudara a contar con mas ganado para destazarlos y vender la carne, para incrementar su negocio y de esa forma poder tener mejores condiciones de vida para él y su familia ya que la situación económica está muy difícil.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in the Hamlet of “Gualindo arriba lolotiquillo,” located within the Morazán department. He is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three children, between the ages of 2 and 6. They all depend on the income that Carmen’s business produces. He’s been buying and selling livestock for the past four years and butchers them twice a week, then sells the meat to his neighbors within the zone. He learned this trade from his father who also worked in the same field and taught him the trade. He will use the money from this loan to buy more livestock to butcher. He will also buy fertilizer so that he can raise grains. The loan will help him to have more livestock to butcher, so that he will have more meat to sell. This will allow him to grow his business and improve his family’s living conditions, now that his financial situation is difficult.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Maria Delma

texts.es:
Doña Maria Delma Z. es madre soltero, comerciante, de la tercera edad pero con mucha energía para sacar adelante su pequeño negocio de venta de comida desde hace treinta y ocho años lo tiene ubicado en el mercado Bisne sector comida, viaja diario desde el municipio el viejo en donde vive junto a su hijo desde hace treinta años, dice sentirse muy agradecida por la confianza que le hemos brindado ya que son créditos a corto plazo que me permiten tener todo lo necesario para mi negocio y estar lista para atender el gusto de mis clientes
 Doña Maria Delma Z. es clienta activa con más de tres años de trabajar con créditos en CEPRODEL de los cuales ha cancelado veintidós créditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad  cabe señalar que todos estos créditos son revolvente cada dos meses, el crédito que tengo activo lo utilice para la compra de granos básicos y otras mercadería que son necesaria para mi negocio
texts.en:
Maria Delma Z. is a single mother; a businesswoman; a senior citizen; and full of energy for moving ahead with business, a 38 year old small food stall, located in the Bisne market’s food section. She travels daily from the town of “El Viejo,” where she has lived with her son for 30 years, and tells us that she is very grateful for the trust that we have placed in her, and that the short term loans have allowed her to have everything she needs for her business, so that she can be ready to attend to her customers’ needs. Maria Delma Z. has been active with CEPRODEL for more than three years and has had 22 previous loans, having demonstrated her responsibility and honesty. It’s fit to say that all of these loans revolve every two months. She says, “I used the current loan to buy basic grains and other items that I needed for my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
la sra. Maria de la Cruz R. P. tiene 48 años de edad, es madre viuda, tiene cinco hijos que dependen de 
ella, Maria vive en la colonia Buena Vista Sur desde hace 10 años. su esposo murio hace unos dos años,
dedicandose por completo al sustento de la familia, Maria tiene un negocio que junto con su esposo cuando estaba vivo lo establecieron en su casa de habitacion.
 
este negocio es el patrimonio de la familia, es una pulperia donde vende productos de consumo popular, como ser: maiz, azucar, arroz, café, manteca, aceite, pollo, queso, jugos, etc, tambien vende cosmeticos, y medicamentos.
 
su negocio esta ubicado en un buen punto, el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor, desea tener mas surtido su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria de la Cruz R. P. is 48 years old and the widowed mother of five dependent children. She has lived in the Buena Vista Sur part of town for 10 years. Her husband, who was completely dedicated to supporting his family, passed away two years ago. Maria now runs a business from her home; one that she and her husband had established. The business is a general store where she sells consumable products, such as dried corn, sugar, rice, coffee, lard, cooking oil, poultry, cheese, juices, etc. She also sells cosmetics and medications. Her business is in a good location and she will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise in bulk. She wants to have a greater assortment so that she can increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Benigno Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Benigno Ricardo G. P., es zapatero se dedica a la reparación y elaboración de zapatos, tiene un tramo en el sector del bisne desde hace mas de 10 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos en edades escolares, habita en el barrio la Resistencia de la Escuela la Normal 2c al sur, ½ c abajo ½ c al sur.

El señor Benigno G. P., solicita crédito para compra de materiales para la reparación y elaboración de zapatos ya que hace zapatos Ortopédicos, Botas de Cuero, etc, según el estilo que el clienta quiera, ya lleva 28 créditos con CEPRODEL y ha demostrado ser muy responsable y  cumplido en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Benigno Ricardo G. P. is a shoemaker who repairs and manufactures shoes and has had a shop in the Bisne sector for the past ten years. He’s married, has two school-aged children, and lives in the Resistencia neighborhood; two blocks to the south and 1/2 block below then 1/2 block south of the Normal school. Benigno is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies for the manufacture and repair of shoes. He makes orthopedic shoes, leather boots, etc; whatever the customer wants. He has had 28 prior loans through CEPRODEL and has proven himself to be responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
Dulce Maria M. A. reside en el Barrio Las Flores de la ciudad de Juticalpa, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus dos hijos. Dulce tiene una pequeña sala de belleza que atiende de Lunes a Sabado desde las 7:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm y cuando sus clientas lo requieren ella presta sus servicios los dias Domingos y cuando estas no pueden ir a su negocio ella va a su domicilio a atenderlos. 

Dulce es una persona muy conocida en el barrio y cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus clientes y vecinos. Ella solicita este prestamo para poder comprar una gran variedad de tintes y tratamientos para el cabello, shampoos, acondicionadores, listick, barniz para uñas, desodorantes, de manera que sus clientas encuentren lo que necesiten para estar siempre bellas. 

Es una mujer que se esfuerza mucho en hacer su trabajo bien para que la clientela de su negocio crezca o en todo caso sigua manteniendose estable. El prestamo sera de mucho beneficio ya que con las ganancias que obtenga podra seguir sosteniento a sus hijos ya que dependen completamente de ella. Ella sueña con tener su propia casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por varios ciclos y conducta de pago es buena.
texts.en:
Dulce Maria M. A. is a 35 year old single mother with two children. They live together in the Las Flores neighborhood of the city of Juticalpa. Dulce has a small beauty salon that she runs Monday through Saturday, from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM. She is also available on Sundays, whenever her customers need her, and also makes house calls when they are unable to go to her salon. [She] is very well known in her neighborhood and comes with very good references from her customers and neighbors. She is asking for this loan in order to buy a large variety of hair coloring, hair treatments, shampoos, conditioners, lipsticks, nail polish, and deodorants, so that her customers will always be able to find what they need to be beautiful. She is a woman who puts a great emphasis on doing her job well, so that her customer base will grow, or at the very least remain stable. This loan will be of great benefit to her because the income that it will produce will allow her to continue supporting her children who depend completely on her. She hopes to have her own home someday and also that her children will have professional careers. [Dulce] has been a client of FAMA for a number of cycles and has had a good repayment record.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and inventory

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
el señor Florentino O. tiene 35 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Reina Marina Reyes.
juntos los dos se dedican a vender pescado y chatarra en un carro de su propiedad.
desde hace 7 años realizan este tipo de actividad con la cual estan sacando adelante la familia. la chatarra  la vende en Jicaro Galan lugar donde se la compran para reciclarla en El Salvador y luego extraer hierro, lamina, y otros metales.
El pescado lo sale a vender en los barrios y colonias de san lorenzo.
 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar chatarra para vender un poco mas ya que para este negocio se requiere de capital para comprar a los recolectores la chatarra diariamente y comprar mas pescado para no tener que viajar tan seguido a la playa.
texts.en:
Florentino O. is 35 years old and is married to Reina Marina Reyes. Together they sell fish and scrap metal out of their car. They have been doing this for seven years and they have been able to move their family ahead. They sell the scrap metal in “Jicaro Galan,” a place from where it it taken to El Salvador for recycling and where the iron, steel, and other metals are extracted. They sell the fish around various neighborhoods and sections of San Lorenzo. They will use the money from this loan to buy more scrap metal in order to have more to resell. His business needs working capital to be able to buy it from the collectors. He also wants to buy more fish so that he does not have to travel to the beach as often.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Scrap metal and fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucila Guillermina

texts.es:
la señora Lucia Guillermina E. vive en la colonia Buena Vista Sur desde hace 45 años, vive con sus hijos y su esposo el señor Manuel Aguilar Gallo quien le ayuda a operar el molino.
 
Lucia tambien con la ayuda de su hija elaboran y venden tortillas, negocio que realizan desde hace varios años en su casa de habitacion,  a mejorado su calidad de vida relata Lucia ya que antes vivian en una casa de piso de tierra, ahora han logrado construir una casa de bloque bien bonita donde viven comodamente.
 
el credito lo utilzara para la compra de maiz, leña y repuestos para el molino.
texts.en:
Lucia Guillermina E. has lived in the Buena Vista Sur section of town for 45 years. She lives with her husband, Manuel Aguilar Gallo, who helps her run her mil. Lucia, with the help of her daughter, also makes and sells tortillas; a business that they have been running out of their home for several years. Their relative quality of life has improved. They used to live in a house with a dirt floor, but they have managed to build a very nice cinder block home where they now live comfortably. She will use the money from this loan to buy dried corn, firewood, and spare parts for her mill.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn, firewood, spare parts

loans.name: Milagro Sulema

texts.es:
la señora Milagro S. Cordova vive en la aldea Laure Abajo desde hace 2 años, dependen de ella dos hijos,  su esposo trabaja en San Pedro Sula quien mensualmente le gira dinero para la casa, Milagro se dedica a la compra y venta de carne de cerdo y res, sale a vender en las aldeas y caserios de la comunidad.
 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar carne de res y cerdo a precio de mayorista y refrescos.

Su mayor aspiracion como persona es que su negocio este mejor cada dia  para asi obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Milagro S. Cordova has lived in the village of Laure Abajo for two years. She has two dependent children and her husband, who works in San Pedro Sula, sends her money every month. Milagro buys and sells pork and beef and goes out to sell in the villages and living areas within the community. She will use the money from this loan to buy beef, pork, and soft drinks at better prices. Her greatest aspiration is for her business to improve each day in order to earn a greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Meat and soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelson Douglas

texts.es:
El señor Nelson Douglas H. G. es acompañado tiene un hijo y labora para MATECSA como Mecánico Industrial el trabajo que el desempeña es dar mantenimiento a las maquinas de hacer adoquines, soldadura y todo tipo de mantenimiento.
El señor H. ha recibido de CEPRODEL  cuatro créditos los cuales le han servido para hacer ampliación de vivienda, sus mejoras han sido progresivas ya que con su salario, son montos pequeños los que puede optar y los materiales están demasiado caros por lo que agradece a CEPRODEL por el apoyo brindado en su progreso y seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson Douglas H. G. is married and has one son. He works as an industrial mechanic for [the company] MATECSA, welding and maintaining paver making machines. Mr. H. has received four previous loans through CEPRODEL, which he has used to progressively improve his home. His salary comes in small amounts, and building materials are expensive. He is grateful to CEPRODEL for the support offered him toward the progress and security of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Edwin Alexis

texts.es:
Edwin reside en Arambala departamento de Morazán, tiene 18 años de edad soltero vive con sus padres, por la mañana estudia segundo año de bachillerato y en la tarde se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como ejotes güisquil, pepino entre otros para de esta forma poder obtener ingresos para sus estudios ya que sus padres no se lo pueden dar por la situación económica.
Desde pequeño se dedica a trabajos agrícolas ayudando a sus padres.
El crédito lo invertirá en compra de abono y semilla para la hortaliza.
Esto le ayudara para la alimentación de sus padres y sus hermanos y para sacar su carrera como bachiller.
Sus aspiraciones son graduarse de bachillerato y si es posible seguir estudiando y tener una casa propia y seguir ayudando a sus padres mejorando las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Edwin lives in Arambala in the state of Morazán. He is 18 years old, single, and lives with his parents. In the morning he goes to high school, and in the afternoon he dedicates himself to planting vegetables such as green beans, chayote, cucumber, etc. In this way he obtains income to pay for his studies since his parents are unable to provide for him. Since he was young, Edwin dedicated himself to agricultural jobs, helping his parents. He will invest this credit in purchasing fertilizer and seeds for the vegetables. This will help him to provide for his parents and siblings and complete his high school degree. Edwin’s dream is to graduate from high school and if possible continue studying. He would like to have his own house one day and continue helping his parents to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for a vegetable garden

loans.name: Maria Eliza

texts.es:
Doña Maria Elisa L. J. es viuda, madre de cuatro hijos , comerciante, vive junto a su familia en el barrio San Agustín,  toda su familia y ella se dedican a la venta de muebles que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación ella es el pilar más importante de su familia ya que es una señora muy trabajadora, emprendedora de carácter fuerte 
 Doña Maria Elisa L. J. es clienta activa desde hace más de cinco años con dieciocho créditos cancelados, todos estos créditos los ha utilizado para la inversión de su negocio ya que constantemente tiene que realizar inversiones para mantener estable su negocio y ofrecer mucha variedades de sus producto para atraer más clientes y hacer frente a la competencia una de sus virtudes es de mantener unidad a su familia trabajando en el mismo negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Elisa L. J. is the widowed mother of four children. She and her family live in the San Agustín neighborhood and they sell furniture out of her home. She is the family’s most important pillar because she is very hard working, entrepreneurial, and of strong character. Maria has been an active client for more than five years and has had eighteen previous loans, which she has repaid. She has used the money from all of the loans to invest in her business, because she needs to constantly make investments to keep the business stable and to be able to offer a large variety of products in order to attract more customers and beat out the competition. One of her virtues is to keep her family united and working in the same business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Lourdes Jeaneth

texts.es:
la sra. Lourdes Jeaneth Martinez tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el barrio Suyapa desde hace 4 años y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacion a podido construir su casa que es de adobe y sin piso.
Lourdes es madre soltera  con dos hijos que dependen de ella.
Lourdes tiene que levantarse temprano a preparar el alimento para sus hijos que van a la escuela y dejar hecho los trabajos de la casa porque a las 8 de la mañana tiene que estar en el puesto donde vende la ropa y las 
sandalias para poder asi vender sus productos con las personas que visitan el mercado de Nacaome.
nos comento que a veces las ventas son bajas y vende poco pero con la ayuda de dios dice que ha salido adelante con su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y sandalias ya que en toda epoca se venden bastante las sandalias porque Nacaome es unos de los lugares mas calientes de Honduras y las personas prefieren andar comodas con sandalias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes Jeaneth Martinez is 43 years old. She has lived in the Suyapa neighborhood for 4 years and with a lot of hard work and dedication she has been able to build her one story adobe house. Lourdes is a single mother with two dependent children. Lourdes has to get up very early to prepare the food for her children who are going to school and do the housework because at 8 in the morning she has to be in the stall where she sells clothing and sandals in order to sell to the people who visit the Nacaome market. She told us that sometimes sales are low and she sells little, but with God's help she has gotten her family ahead. She will use the loan to buy clothing and sandals since these sell well year round. Nacaome is one of th hottest places in Honduras and people prefer to be comfortable with sandals..

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and sandals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis R. Z. labora para MATECSA en el área de mantenimiento, se entiende en la reparación y soldadura todo tipo de trabajo de soldadura en maquinarias etc., tiene un hijo es casado.
Considero que los préstamos que CEPRODEL  me ha otorgado me han servido para mejorar mi condición  de vida la de mi esposa y las de mi hijo. asegurar mi propiedad y así sentir mejor la seguridad de la familia.
texts.en:
José Luis R. Z. works as a maintenance man for [a company called] MATECSA, where he repairs and welds all sorts of machinery. He has one married son. “I believe that the loans that I have gotten through CEPRODEL have helped me improve my quality of life, that of my wife, and my son. They have helped me to secure my property and made my family feel more secure.”

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marta Gloria

texts.es:
la sra. Marta Gloria C. tiene 31 años de edad,  vive con su esposo en su casa ubicada en la aldea
el Pedrerito La Montaña,  dependen de ese hogar 4 hijos que estan estudiando en la escuela y colegio de la comunidad. 
Marta se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular como ser: azucar, manteca, arroz, jabon, aceite, jugos, refrescos, tambien tiene un trabajo de medio tiempo en una escuela.
el esposo trabaja en una finca y le ayuda economicamente.
Marta utilizara el credito para comprar mas mercaderia para su pulperia ya que desea surtir un poco mas su negocio y asi obtener mayores ganancias.
 
tiene un proyecto con su familia de construir su nueva casa ya que la desean hacer de bloque material mas resistente, actualmente viven en una que es de tierra y es muy frajil y cuando llueve es muy peligroso que se pueda caer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta Gloria C. is 31 years old. She lives with her husband in their house located in the town of el Pedrerito La Montaña. There are 4 dependent children in the home who are in the community primary and high schools. Marta sells products of popular consumption such as: sugar, lard, rice, soap, oil, juice, and soda. She aslo has a part time job at the elementary school. Her husband works at a farm and he helps her financially. Marta will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store since she wants to diversify her business little by little and thus obtain more earnings. She has a project with her family building a new house, since they want to make it of more durable blocks. Presently they live in an earthen house which is very fragile and when it rains there is danger that it could cave in.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soap, toilet paper, corn meal, flour, eggs, beans, rice, sugar, lard, oil, pasta, sauces, churros,  soda, candles, matches, light bulbs, batteries.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Health expenses

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
El señor V. labora para AFUNIC, donde se desempeña como, es soltero tiene una persona a su cargo.
CEPRODEL me ha otorgado 2 créditos  han sido para gastos personales de salud. 
 CEPRODE me ha brindado la  oportunidad de resolver mis problemas de salud.
texts.en:
Mr. V. works for AFUNIC (Association of United Pharmacies in Nicaragua). He has one person under his care. “Ceprodel has granted me two loans that have been for personal health expenses. Ceprodel has given me the opportunity to resolve my health problems.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses for eye exams and to buy glasses

loans.name: El Puente Group

texts.es:
el grupo el Puente esta integrado por 4 mujeres muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante con sus negocios y con sus familias, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Gloria Alejandrina V. se dedica a la venta de golosinas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, dicha actividad tiene más de 2 años de realizarla, con esta actividad a generado ingresos,  tiene muy buena clientela ya que esta ubicada en un lugar estratégico en una de las entradas de mayor transito del municipio de Las Trojes.
Gloria es madre de 2 hijos los cuales estan en edad escolar y estudian en la escuela primaria de su localidad y su esposo se dedica a la Ganadería ya que esta zona es muy apta para esta actividad y de esta forma se ayudan mutuamente en el hogar, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para realizar sus golosinas y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes
